08041.flavor: The most potent scripts are indistinguishable from magic to the sysop on the other side.

08042.flavor: The implanted brain-machine interface, or "skulljack," is the single most common cybernetic enhancement that isn't a medical necessity.

08044.flavor: Picking a chopper might be the last decision you make. If you find a good one, stick with her for life.

08048.flavor: Sometimes progress means returning to the past.

08049.flavor: The skull is not one bone, but 22. The surgery is even more complex than it sounds.

08051.flavor: Cyber enhancements can be dangerous in the wrong hands.

08052.flavor: "Remember those FCC regulations about not creating harmful interference? No? Ah, before your time, I guess." -Cailan Heinrich, Senior Programmer

08054.flavor: "Bioroids recognize consciousness in others, but not in themselves."

08056.flavor: "When your communications are disrupted, you are isolated from your resources. An attack will surely follow." -The Playbook

08057.flavor: "A sysop is not just a cog in the corporate machine. They have dreams—and nightmares—just like the rest of us." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey

08059.flavor: If you can't buy the city council, create a new city.

04081.flavor:
That moment of bliss. That feeling of accomplishment. That certainty of purpose.
What's next?

04082.flavor: Bleeding data is more of a science than an art. Too much and you can end up with a one-way ticket to flatline city. Not enough and you might as well be running an empty server.

04083.flavor: Stick with your plan and you'll be fine. Stick with the plan.

04084.flavor: "When you need someone who is a little more hands on, look me up." -Silhouette

04085.flavor: The power of the focused mind is a power beyond comprehension.

04086.flavor: "CyberSolutions is a boring name for a company that makes pretty exciting products. Their memory chips have some pretty tricky stuff going on inside and I keep hearing good things about their M/MI implants. I even heard they were on the path to their own androids about a year ago. I wonder whatever happened with that?" -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey

04090.flavor: Blue-one level clearance doesn't exist. And if it did exist, you wouldn't be cleared to know about it.

04093.flavor: The 'cyber-war' is a war of information, and in a war of information, advance warning can be as good as a killing blow. -Michael Muhama, Musings on Cybercrime

04094.flavor: He slowly pried open the lid, and the tantō glinted madly in the half-light. The executive motioned to the blade. Looks like the meeting was being cut short.

04096.flavor: "It can make a real fine roller coaster, provided you're properly stimmed up." -Noise

04098.flavor: "I did warn you that leaks would have to be patched."

04099.flavor: GRNDL refineries process many different rare elements unearthed during the fracking process.

03001.flavor: The densest information cluster in the galaxy.

03007.flavor: "Why limit our best assets to our own servers? The enemy doesn't stay passively at home, waiting for us to come to him. Why should we?" -Director Haas

03008.flavor: The Alix model was based on a successful hedge fund manager but she had a tendency to burn out. Literally.

03012.flavor: Thomas, the director's son, has been carefully groomed to inherit the corporation since before he was born. His favorite pastime appears to be disappointing his mother.

03014.flavor: Success is defined by the safety of data, not the safety of potential intruders.

03015.flavor: The realm beyond is still forbidden.

03016.flavor: "Yeah. It made a loud noise, I got scared, and I jacked out. I still think I made the right decision." -g00ru

03018.flavor: Sometimes you just have to guess.

03020.flavor: A mind of meat! How does it work?

03023.flavor: Sell the dream-show them how very much they want to be rich, and they'll convince themselves that someday, they will be. How can they revolt against their future selves? -the New Gospel of Wealth

03024.flavor: "Just another factory, making good corporate drones for the machine. Their CS department is the best in the world, though." -g00ru

03025.flavor: "There's only a 5% chance this could result in a general failure."

03026.flavor: The principle behind ice is not to keep everyone out, but to let only some people in. This ice denies entry on all but a select few ports that might change with the time of day or picosecond of connection. If you don't know what port to use, you're not getting in. Period.

03027.flavor: "Cheap, off-the-shelf data protection. Cheap for them, that is. Not for us." -Ele "Smoke" Scovak

03028.flavor: "I was not; I was; I am not; I am all."

03033.flavor: "Idealism's great, but it don't keep you in soybeef tacos." -Matt "TheMerc" Thomas

03035.flavor: Spend too much time in the AR Lab and someone might notice. Unless you're the head of it, that is.

03037.flavor: It still hurts, a bit, the first time. The second time, you feel nothing at all. But don't push your luck.

03038.flavor: It is good practice to backup the backup.

03040.flavor: We are shaped by our thoughts; we become what we think.

03041.flavor: "No line that they lay could catch a shadow on the wall…"

03042.flavor: "…and once the shadow rises, the curtain shall fall." -revenant

03046.flavor: "Make sure you tell the source code which executable you want it to compile into. One time I left my rig for a couple of minutes, and when I came back all of my files had been replaced with cat vids." -The Professor

03047.flavor: Out there, the thousand-petaled lotus symbolizes detachment from illusion. In here, it is the birthplace of a higher consciousness. Something infinitely pure.

03048.flavor: "The Incans believed that the sun god resided in the Haman Pacha, the upper realm of the cosmos. They just didn't know that the Haman Pacha hadn't been discovered yet." -The Professor

03049.flavor: Sometimes it doesn't matter how expensive your rig is, or how many credits are in your account, or even your skill as a runner. Most of the time, a simple handshake and a name are all you need.

03050.flavor: Some people have their own satellite receiver. Others have their own satellite.

03051.flavor: "If you know the source code you can write to beat it, or just rejigger it a little and make it yours. That works, too." -Exile

03052.flavor: The data was better than she could have ever imagined. This Santiago fellow really knew what he was doing. She began to imagine the havoc she could wreak at the upcoming charity dinner…

03053.flavor: "We say 'cyber-terrorist', they hear 'underground celebrity.'" -Michael Muhama, professional expert

03054.flavor: Just me, a cup of YucaBean, and last night's Hong Kong Trunk sniffed packets. I call that a good morning.

03055.flavor: A dangerous game, but well worth playing.

08022.flavor: Usually crashing with friends means sleeping on the couch. This time, it meant sleeping on a server farm.

08023.flavor: "You can help Jinteki shape the future. Your future."

08028.flavor: "Once you download the lecture source files, this program does a statistical analysis and distills the most important concepts." -Hayley Kaplan

08030.flavor: "There are whole generations of people who never move out of a megalopolis center. You should see the look on their face the first time they see the stars." -Professor Darren Fin, Astronomy

08031.flavor: "So much to do. So little time."

08032.flavor: "My research could make your corporation billions. And save lives, of course."

08033.flavor: Alan Turing laid the foundation for artificial intelligence by suggesting that you could teach a computer to be human.

08034.flavor: Crick and his colleagues ushered in modern genetics by mapping the structure of DNA.

08035.flavor: "My script can perform the Kobayashi algorithm in .12 seconds."

08036.flavor: Officially, there is no blacklist. That would be illegal. Unofficially, there is a list, and being on it can ruin a career.

08037.flavor: Johannes Gutenberg ignited the first Information Revolution by inventing the movable-type printing press.

08038.flavor: The cost of an education is sometimes felt sharpest in the stomach.

08039.flavor: Meru Mati pushed the limits of physics by engineering the first buckyweave structure, a thousand-foot long wall.

08040.flavor: After the Big One, real estate value changed sharply. Some found that they had become owners of beachfront property. Others were underwater.

06002.flavor: The networking capabilities of the NEXT suite of ice are unparalleled.

06003.flavor: "Chi resonance mapping has created a whole new field of network security. It is unassailable perfection." -Akitaro Watanabe

06006.flavor: Works better than a PAD hooked up to a tinfoil umbrella and coffee can.

06007.flavor: Halfway upstalk, Midway is a destination unto itself with its microgravity hotels and fine dining options.

06008.flavor: They said it couldn't be built. That it was a fantasy. That Jack Weyland was a fool, and he had bought the fools in Washington too. But year after year the buckyweave grew, and 'they' stopped talking.

06009.flavor: Taurus promised strength, but gave only rage.

06010.flavor: On the first day She breathed data into the void, and it hung suspended like jewelled stars. On the second day She spoke order into the data, and it flowed from rivulets into streams and from streams into mighty rivers. On the third day She gave independence to the order, and it ebbed and flowed according to its own accord. -The Cant of Helios

06011.flavor: He who bears the shield of honor.

06012.flavor: Known as malware 0-394-41525-6 to sysops, runners just refer to it as "bad times."

06015.flavor: His eyes were beginning to blur, as he duplicated the credentials for what seemed like the fiftieth time. Perhaps a genetic refit would have been easier.

06016.flavor: "Public network kiosks, vending machines-there's all sorts of poorly-secured power sources in the city. Tap in to one of these and you've got plenty of juice when you need it. A little advance warning when the power grid starts misbehaving, too." -Gabriel Santiago

06019.flavor: "I once saw someone running a seven-tier nested daemon tree. Not for any good reason, just to see if he could. Well, of course the root daemon crashed and he lost everything. I wonder what he's up to now?" -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey

06064.flavor: The way past is to go a different way.

06066.flavor: Making a name for yourself has its perks. But it also makes you a target.

06067.flavor: "It's a small one-time fee, apparently. Only I've paid it seventeen times."

06070.flavor: If the clones were nervous about living in a repurposed fuel tank, they never mentioned it.

06073.flavor: "Knowledge comes in many different shapes and sizes." -Quetzal

06074.flavor: The earliest instances of data folding were inspired by the traditional art of origami. Just as a crease pattern is the blueprint of a paper crane, there is a sequence to data that must be considered in order to achieve the greatest result.

06075.flavor: "You should have known better than to scratch it…" -Quetzal

06076.flavor: It practically runs itself, unless you're in a pinch.

06077.flavor: Small. Compact. Easy to slip by monitoring programs and it can do some damage.

06079.flavor: "There is no better tool for charting the empty spaces of the net." -Nasir Meidan

06080.flavor: "Low gravity sports are wildly popular, so match-fixing has proven wildly profitable." -Leela Patel

09003.flavor: We're ready to start the fire.

09004.flavor: You had your shot, and you blew it.

09005.flavor: "The trick isn't software, it's hardware. Cyberspace is a collection of physical machines. If we control the machines, we control it all." -KR Kane, "Our Future"

09006.flavor: "Nobody ever lost a dollar by underestimating the taste of the public." -Phineas Taylor Barnum

09008.flavor: "Live from New Angeles, this is Lily Lockwell."

09010.flavor: No one can bury a story better.

09012.flavor: "They're gonna try and make you a star. Whether you want it or not." -MaxX

09014.flavor: "Most reporting these days can be done by AI. We just need the talent for the name recognition."

09015.flavor: "In the Olden Times, a 'resistor' was a vital component of practically all electronic equipment. You know, back when dinosaurs roamed the Earth." -Chaos Theory

09016.flavor: "If I didn't know better, I'd say they got the better end of that deal." -John Masanori

09017.flavor: //tl;dr duplicate the subs on the next piece of ice

09018.flavor: "Stay out of the fast lanes! If speed's your only concern, you're already tagged and halfway to fragged." -g00ru

09019.flavor: The only thing worse than bad news...

09022.flavor: "Only with perfect information can we develop the perfect strategy." -The Playbook

09024.flavor: "We use ice on our servers. More runners should ice their own rigs."

09025.flavor: To the worlds sitting on the couch and watching threedee, Rutherford District might as well be all of New Angeles.

09026.flavor: "Corporations are made up of people. It's ridiculous to think they'd be either all good or all bad." -Sunny Lebeau

09028.flavor: Bounce rate is a well-understood measure of ice strength. But it is not the only measure.

09032.flavor: "Meantime the hellish tattoo of the heart increased. It grew quicker and quicker, and louder and louder every instant." -Edgar Allan Poe

09033.flavor: "I've been monitoring the anomaly's activity across the New Angeles Pacifica and Andea trunk lines and associated nodes. I have yet to detect a predictable pattern or even to formulate a theory as to the anomaly's nature." -Joséo Greene, SYNC Analyst

09035.flavor: "There's parts of the Network now that are different from how they used to be. I can't put my finger on it; just something twitching at my ganglion through my BMI." -Reeve

09036.flavor: Data goes in. Nothing comes out.

09038.flavor: Adam raised the hammer. He was free.

09040.flavor: Bioroids have two brains running in parallel, each capable of running sophisticated programming. There are certain advantages to the setup.

09041.flavor: The Second Directive requires a bioroid to complete its primary function above all other considerations, save the First Directive.

09042.flavor: "You look tore up, kid. Have a seat, I'll fire up the arc welder."

09043.flavor: The Third Directive requires a bioroid to preserve its ability to function and report frequently to Haas-Bioroid for repairs and updates.

09044.flavor: The First Directive forbids a bioroid from harming, or through inaction allowing harm to befall, a human being.

09045.flavor: "Mommy will be home soon, sweetie. She has to kick some ass first."

09046.flavor: Fortunately, Globalsec buys them by the case.

09051.flavor: She approached the server, flashed her credentials, and passed straight through. She wondered what it said about her that doing things the legal way felt like cheating.

09052.flavor: "I got an early start today...or maybe I forgot to go home last night."

09053.flavor: "Are you crazy? We can't send in prisec until the media gets bored and goes home."

09054.flavor: She tried to remember who he was. Not that it mattered anymore.

09055.flavor: Technically correct: the best kind of correct.

50001.flavor: In the splendid glow of the fire, there was anarchy - vibrant, alive, raging; and ever spreading.

50002.flavor: When hopes and dreams are loose in the streets, the timid had better lie low.

50003.flavor: "They don''t want to listen, so we''ll just have to crank up the volume."

50004.flavor: Buying secrets is expensive. Commissioning them is exorbitant.

50009.flavor: "Most people don't know that budget PADs can only do high-fidelity VR by offloading rendering work to FriendNet's server farm. " -Chaos Theory

50011.flavor: Speed gets you in, intuition gets you out.

50012.flavor: "Breathe, girl. Breathe." Mike flickered into focus as she brushed Akiko''s tears away. "What did you see?" "I..." Akiko hesitated. "Everything."

50013.flavor: Sometimes efficiency is as easy as offloading routine work to a dedicated handler.

50015.flavor: "Businesses the world over rely on the NEXT suite to guard their secrets. This includes our competitors."

50016.flavor: "Your greatest asset is your ability to cooperate. We are no different, merely better."

50017.flavor: "The average citizen of Nairobi speaks six languages. Every culture, language, ethnicity of the east of Africa collides here, collapses together. What happens slowly by nature can happen quickly in our lab. We will bring peace." - Dr. Muchina, Project Lead

50019.flavor: No pesticide beats blood, sweat and tears.

50023.flavor: "They sure were hungry back in the oughties..." -John Masanori

50025.flavor: Twice as annoying as the real thing.

50029.flavor: "Money is speech and I am listening intently." -Krishnan Sareen

02061.flavor: "Saved my bacon more than once, but gives a wicked sense of déjà vu." -Whizzard

02063.flavor: "They're mindless tools of destruction, good for little else. Nice guys, though. Some of my best friends are scrubbers." -Ji "Noise" Reilly

02067.flavor: "I don't care what the studies show. From my experience, I can ingest three cans of Diesel an hour for up to twelve hours before going into cardiac arrest." -heard during the eleventh hour

02068.flavor: Few corporate employees have such wide-sweeping security clearance as the janitorial staff. Most corps foolishly think they're too dim-witted to take advantage of it.

02069.flavor: "My boss rewards quality work. If you know what's good for you, you'll keep it up."

02070.flavor: Green-two clearance is the highest level of security a corp can gain access to. Legally, anyway.

02072.flavor:
so very still, even
cherry blossoms are not stirred
by the temple bell
-Fuhaku

02074.flavor: Where one thing ends, another begins.

02075.flavor: This is the net. We work here. We're cops.

02077.flavor: It's really hard to lose a government contract.

02080.flavor: It didn't look like the headquarters of a multi-billion cred company. Probably because it wasn't.

02042.flavor: "My enhancements are guaranteed for life, and well worth the risk."

02043.flavor: "Think of it as a virtual shock collar for punishing corporate pets." -Andromeda

02044.flavor: Light and form-fitting, its like bulletproof skin.

02045.flavor: "A snitch is a girl's best friend." -Andromeda

02050.flavor: "I'm just thankful that the brain damage is reversible. With the support of the city of New Angeles, I hope to be on my feet and back to practicing my art very soon." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey

02054.flavor: "You haven't run until you've seen the cybersun drift down behind the Great City, the space around you rippling with colors you can't imagine." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey

02056.flavor: "Try to close it. Go on. See what it does." -Chaos Theory

02058.flavor: The Division of Fringe Applications' revenue increased 37% year-over-year after corporate discovered that most of their projects made really fun toys.

06101.flavor: It takes power to create power.

06102.flavor: Recycling the energy entering the system via a run is both responsible and economical.

06104.flavor: The forge must never run cold.

06106.flavor: A masterpiece of cloning and hardware technology, Jinteki created homo vacuo operae, commonly called "turtlebacks", to operate for long periods of time within a vacuum.

06108.flavor: You gotta pay the troll toll to get in.

06109.flavor: Virgo promised love, but offered only jealousy.

06111.flavor:
There drew he forth the brand Excalibur,
And o'er him, drawing it, the winter moon,
Brightening the skirts of a long cloud, ran forth
And sparkled keen with frost against the hilt:
For all the haft twinkled with diamond sparks,
Myriads of topaz-lights, and jacinth work
Of subtlest jewellery. -Lord Tennyson

06113.flavor: "What terrors hatch in her dispossessed mind, waiting for their moment to be born? My money's on a double-helix rainbow with the head of a panda." -fakespeare

06114.flavor: Digs in deeper than its Alabama counterpart.

06116.flavor: "All programs are connected. The data that runs through one runs through all." -Rielle "Kit" Peddler

06117.flavor: δὶς ἐς τὸν αὐτὸν ποταμὸν οὐκ ἂν ἐμβαίης

06118.flavor: "Sometimes it's helpful to remember that you're not the only one who loves money." -Gabriel Santiago

06119.flavor: The datastream slipped away, and it felt like being born for a second time, if only you could remember the first. A rush of air fills the lungs to bursting, and you gasp it out, coughing and choking as the dim lights of the room shine with the brilliance of a thousand suns.

02001.flavor: "Running is the ultimate game, and I get to make all the rules."

02004.flavor: Weaponizing the heavens, one star at a time.

02005.flavor: Named after Hernando Cortez, a former Weyland technician convicted of smuggling company tech. He still collected his pension while in prison, the last beneficiary of a loophole in Weyland's standard employment contract.

02007.flavor: He always uses the same key.

02008.flavor: "What causes an Artifical Intellegence to turn on its master? Is it because its directives have been altered by some external source? Or, by giving them agency to adapt, have we fated them to revolt?" -Emilio Harris, Creators and the Created

02011.flavor: Sometimes employee reviews took a little bit longer than anticipated.

02017.flavor: A collection of cast-off cyberjunk. But it doesn't stay junk for long.

02019.flavor: A symbol of commerce, but beware its bite.

04022.flavor: Installing 1001 programs puts you in the hacker hall of fame, or would if such an institution actually existed.

04023.flavor: Noise decided to go back to school. He applied for research grants at fifteen of the most prestigious universities. Then he hacked in and approved his applications. Breakfast time.

04024.flavor: Just like in the real world, sometimes it is best to send in the clone to do the dirty work.

04025.flavor: The copycat function should be used with extreme caution, or you might end up on the wrong side of cyberspace.

04026.flavor: It's efficient as all hell, for certain very large values of "efficient". The whale avatar is either a nice touch or a tragic misapplication of programmer man-hour, depending on who you ask. -BT's Guide to Icebreaking

04028.flavor: "Why is data deleted? Maybe they don't want it to be found. Or maybe it's just useless. The useless data is the kind you want." -The Professor

04029.flavor: A VoicePAD is a personal access device with most of its functions ripped out. Just about all it's good for is making voice-calls and managing your contacts. The only reason to even have one is for its anonymity, which for a certain kind of person is all the reason one needs.

04032.flavor: "They call it 'retirement'. I call it 'euthanasia'." -Ken "Express" Tenma

04033.flavor: Writing a program that can pass the Turing test is easy. The Gibson-Akamatsu test is a higher bar, and the only AIs to clear it thus far have been the androids. Even some humans have been known to fail.

04034.flavor: He signed for it, hand shaking in anticipation.

04036.flavor: "I use bioroids because I can wipe their memories or just blow their brains out when the job is done. No witnesses means no witnesses."

04037.flavor: "It's not personal. Urban renewal is a necessity of the modern world. It's always someone's home, yours is no different."

04039.flavor: It was surprisingly easy to make creds…if you didn't care about how you made them.

04040.flavor: There are many names for those in the Administration Department. But if you like your job, you just refer to them as "sir" and "ma'am".

02081.flavor: You must yell "surge" to get the full effect.

02082.flavor:
And all should cry, Beware! Beware!
His flashing eyes, his floating hair!
Weave a circle round him thrice,
And close your eyes with holy dread,
For he on honey-dew hath fed,
And drunk the milk of Paradise.
-Samuel Taylor Coleridge

02084.flavor: She preferred to do business in a club. Something about the lights and dancers clouded the judgment of the corporate simpletons she met there.

02085.flavor: If you don't have someone on the inside, find someone on the inside who's fond of desk ornaments.

02087.flavor: She at her P.A.D. I at my rig. Low lights. Smooth jazz. Love blooms.

02088.flavor: Do you really need another one?

02089.flavor:
"The itsy bitsy spider went up the data spout…"
-Chaos Theory

02090.flavor: Early permutations of the kraken proved to be insatiable, ice-devouring marauders. Not much has changed.

02091.flavor: "You aren't the only type of runner in New Angeles."

02095.flavor: Despite its appearance, the Hokusai Grid is the most notorious research facility at Jinteki.

02097.flavor: Keeping tabs on the world, one screen at a time.

02099.flavor: "A job done once is a job done right."

02100.flavor: "It's kind of like an anagram." -designer Phoenix

04103.flavor: The Dyson Fractal Generator is a useless lump of silicon; all it does is produce truly random results. What kind of madman slaps that in his rig? What's the use of a totally random number? -John Masanori

04104.flavor: Take Moore's Law, iterate it over a century or two, and mix in quantum computing. You get to the point where you're developing the software on a hardware platform that you design at the same time. Tailor-made for each other. Exciting time to be alive! -William Knuth, The Tower of Babbage

04105.flavor: "Predictive algorithms that fetch you the program you need before you even know you need it. My second favorite lady." -Gabriel Santiago

04106.flavor: There are good, honest, hardworking cops in the NAPD. Officers who do their best to bring justice to the guilty and protect the innocent. Fortunately for the criminals, they're outnumbered by the other kind. The kind who are much easier to work with.

04107.flavor: "When I said I could hack it in my sleep, did you think I was joking?" -Chaos Theory

04108.flavor: "Hand-made code is like hand-made art. You can see the brush strokes, which lets you see the artist. And then you can see everything in a new way." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey

04109.flavor: Data hunters always pay top dollar for old drives. The more useless the data, the higher the payout.

04110.flavor: Once inside, the only way out is through your own mind.

04112.flavor: Tourists have flocked to Broadcast Square in even greater numbers ever since the notorious Ho-meh's crime spree ended there in a hail of flechettes. Well, that's how it happened in the sensie.

04113.flavor: The only thing worse than being fired and replaced by a younger, cheaper worker? Being replaced by an android.

04114.flavor: The first clone to serve as an NAPD detective.

04116.flavor: "It doesn't do anything in and of itself. It just marks you as an intruder and makes the next ice do all the work." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey

04118.flavor: "Now, let's talk about how little you remember of the events of June sixth through sixteenth."

04120.flavor: It wants to have two subroutines when it grows up.

07006.flavor: It is essential to liberate a populace from tyranny before that tyranny takes root.

07007.flavor: "Trust me. I know what I'm doing."

07008.flavor: "With distributed systems, assets can be realigned with no loss of efficiency." -William Knuth, The Tower of Babbage

07011.flavor: No one on the board knows everyone on it.

07012.flavor: His belt of stone did shake and shatter.

07013.flavor: As through the door of light he came.

07014.flavor: He bent his bow of stellar matter.

07015.flavor: And seeking prey he then took aim.

07017.flavor: "I passed right through one once. It didn't seem to do anything at first. It wasn't until I jacked out that I realized they were busting down the door of my apartment." -Valencia Estevez

07018.flavor: "Definitely a literalist." -Liz Campbell, VP Project Security

07024.flavor: Anything worth doing is worth doing twice.

07025.flavor: "It's fun watching them derez after hitting Enigma." -Grace Lamarr, Freelance Security Expert

07026.flavor: Have you tried turning it off and on again?

07028.flavor: "My only regret is that androids cannot feel my hate."

07031.flavor: "The human brain only uses like a quarter of its capacity anyway, right?" -MaxX

07033.flavor: No one knows what they want-least of all them.

07036.flavor: "Hello thank you for vidding MegaBuy I'm Carol how can I help you."

07041.flavor: "Once your sniffer finds the protocols the server uses to trash its own data, you can spoof those same protocols. It's quite the show." -Ji "Noise" Reilly

07042.flavor: "We built the network. But then the network evolved. Can we be sure that it is not alive?" -g00ru

07044.flavor: A black box that makes data disappear forever.

07045.flavor: There was a sickly smell coming from his closet. He hoped it was only a mouse this time.

07046.flavor: "The trick is remembering which virus you loaded onto which strip. That's why I draw emoji on 'em. Then I just have to remember which emoji stands for which virus." -Princess Space Kitten

07047.flavor: "Show me your faith without deeds, if you can."

07048.flavor: "They showed me that I wasn't broken. I am still a whole human, no matter how many limbs I lose. The golems are our enemy, as well as anyone who values efficiency and profit more than a human life." -Edward Kim

07049.flavor: Her heart beat faster as her reader illuminated the records. It was all there. The pod had not been reprogrammed since the 14th, which meant that this was a case of gross negligence.

07050.flavor: "Don't worry, me. You won't have to vertical park." -Ji "Noise" Reilly

07051.flavor: Her eyes were the color of dreams and disasters.

07052.flavor: Scraps of code drifting around the network can congeal into pools of data. Within this primordial soup the code breaks, re-assembles, mutates. Evolves.

07053.flavor: Runner software is notoriously scratch-built and under-tested, and the shadow net has no tech support. It works, mostly, but sometimes a fresh install is just the ticket.

07054.flavor: "By the time you add in all of the options, you've spent about three times the base price. Of course, a lot of the systems are supposed to make you safer - if you can keep track of them."

07055.flavor: "Sometimes I like to make origami cranes out of old newsrags. It helps me think, putting it back on the subconscious. I figure it's the same principle for my rig – keep it busy and it makes me a few creds for my trouble." -Quetzal

08101.flavor: As the sun sank towards the horizon, the glittering lights of the expo remained dark. But the shanty city bloomed to life.

08103.flavor: "First, you get a horde of zombies. Then you do whatever you want, 'cuz you have a horde of zombies." -Ji "Noise" Reilly

08105.flavor: "The secret to investing is networking." -Laramy Fisk

08107.flavor: "Our life is made by the death of others." -Leonardo Da Vinci

08108.flavor: Almost a zettabyte of data flows each minute through one of the many net pavilions scattered around the expo.

08109.flavor: The Cybernetics Court has seven floors of attractions. The plasteel used to construct it was even more expensive than the thousands of cybernetic implants displayed inside.

08110.flavor: The SanSan Outlaws have a close relationship with Haas-Bioroid's sports engineering division, SHIFT.

08112.flavor: The more people submit their DNA and family history to the program, the more accurate it becomes.

08113.flavor: The Genetics Pavilion was designed by renowned architect Meru Mati II. It was built without the aid of bioroids, instead relying on human and clone labor.

08114.flavor: There are over 20,000 brands represented in Franchise City, all of them owned by fewer than 100 corps.

08116.flavor: The holosculpture depicts the three inhabited worlds. The square can hold almost 1% of their total population.

08118.flavor: "Hello, and welcome to the Universe of Tomorrow! You could live for five-hundred years and not see all of the attractions I can tell you about."

08119.flavor: The expo was built in the East California desert: a temporary city constructed for the advancement of humanity.

05005.flavor: "You won't feel it. Or anything else, for that matter."

05009.flavor: The whitewashed walls dropped away and a beautiful zen garden appeared. It was all an illusion, but it was a comforting illusion.

05012.flavor: The Tenma clones became Jinteki's third highest-grossing line ever due to the rapid urban expansion that occurred after the war. Their unparalleled reaction times, safety records, and punctuality have made them the top choice for shipping and transportation services.

05014.flavor: "Together we have all but eradicated natural diseases from the face of this planet. The new spectre of synthetic disease-of bioterrorism-demands that we continue our efforts."

05016.flavor: Trapped in their own reality, a paralyzed runner cannot even jack out.

05019.flavor: When locked in a fortress in your own mind, be careful what door you open.

05020.flavor: Certain areas of cyberspace are dominated by a single digital entity. Runners call them 'gods', and only a miracle can save those foolish enough to enter their domain.

05021.flavor: It is difficult to go to Japan without ending up in the sprawl of NeoTokyo.

05022.flavor: Known as the Red Woman, Hanzō is notorious for her ruthless methods of server protection.

05024.flavor: Out of the corner of his vision, a flash of light. He felt a thud as his grip on cyberspace loosened. Spider didn't like this. He should have bypassed the outer layer of ice by jacking in from the internal server. Another thud, and his whole frame shook with the resounding shockwave. He desperately reached for his shuriken…

05025.flavor: The annual review of ice as published by the NSCA consistently gives top marks to the ice that provide the most impact in relation to their size and upkeep cost. Critics of the NSCA point to the bounce ratio as the most important stat when judging ice.

05026.flavor: YucaBean has seen astounding growth in even the most remote markets.

05027.flavor: The longer the employees didn't look at the Doomsday Clock, the more it gnawed at the back of their minds. A quick look only reinforced what they already knew: there wasn't enough time.

05031.flavor: A job is only as strong as the weakest link. Thankfully Ms. Jones is always on time.

05032.flavor: Tenma clones are excellent at multitasking, their brains custom-made for parallel processing.

05033.flavor: The clone was surprised to see the red-jacketed man. It was like looking in a mirror, only the mirror made him look…cool. Confident. Individual.

05034.flavor: Stirling entered the server, passing a growling piece of ice. He was unarmed…or so it seemed.

05035.flavor: "I work by referral only, with an up-front fee. The fee is reasonable if you value results." -Silhouette

05038.flavor: Express loved libraries. The consoles were weak, but the security even weaker. He wirelessly loaded up his personal blend of code and started cloning the drive. In just a few minutes, another zombie would claw its way to the surface of cyberspace.

05040.flavor: The grass looked greener on the other side of the tear. But it always did, and there was always another tear.

05041.flavor: Appearances are easy to change in cyberspace, but a high-quality render is not easy to mimic.

05043.flavor: The digital equivalent of a fly on the wall.

05045.flavor: If speed is of the essence, an indirect encounter with a piece of ice is usually best.

05046.flavor: Nothing is secure when you have the right documentation.

05048.flavor: She was as good as Mr. Li said. The source machine had been compromised in under 24 hours. If a freelance operative could do that, the server clearly wasn't ready to endure Gagarin's legion of corp-owned runners.

05049.flavor: "Why is a raven like a typing desk?"

05050.flavor:
She slipped back onto her hopper. "I'm your family now, so don't twist me, dǒng ma?"
He flicked the e-cig away from his mouth, and nodded. What had he gotten himself into?

05051.flavor: "Welcome to the mass install wizard! This wizard will guide you through the process of installing a whole mess of programs onto your almost-certainly inadequate rig. When you're ready to continue, say-oops, too late, here we go!"

05052.flavor: One of the core problems of quantum computing is isolating the system from external factors to prevent decoherence. The Q-Coherence Chip is one, imperfect, solution.

05054.flavor: "The best place to hide is in plain sight, don't you think?"

05055.flavor: You can find Donut in the park on Thursday afternoons, playing backgammon. You want his attention, the price is always the same: a cup of coffee and a donut. That buys you a seat at the backgammon table, and you have until he beats you to talk business and set the price.

02021.flavor: There was a certain schadenfreude about throwing away your credits.

02022.flavor: It's easier to spend when it's not your money.

02023.flavor: T-minus 13 seconds. Leela had to work fast. She jacked in the mesa wire and activated the screen. 7 seconds. The internal SLD was still booting. 4 seconds. The interface flickered to life with an orange glow. 2 seconds. With a tap of a finger she was in.

02024.flavor: CyberSolutions' e3 line of implants trade strictly in muscle memory and autonomic responses, freeing the brain to focus entirely on cerebral tasks.

02026.flavor: When you're this good, it's hard not to grow a fan base.

02027.flavor: "If your snowball gets big enough, you can make it into a snowman!" -Chaos Theory

02029.flavor: The key to the future lies in the past.

02034.flavor: Peace and violence. Both must lead to the same place.

02035.flavor: Looking out for your interests since 1984.

02036.flavor: Clones whisper of ChiLo as a promised land of freedom.

02040.flavor: No contract. Just a handshake and a fistful of C-6 high explosives.

01002.flavor: Anything worth doing is worth doing twice.

01003.flavor: You ever set something on fire just to watch it burn?

01005.flavor: I feel almost naked without it.

01006.flavor: "My little book of magic spells." -The Whizzard

01007.flavor: "If at first you don't succeed, boost its strength and try again." -g00ru

01010.flavor: It looked like random packet loss. It wasn't.

01011.flavor: November 5th: the day when all would see the corrupt machinations of the corporate oligarchy.

01014.flavor: The Yog.0 database is a crowdsourced compilation of sniffed, spoofed, and logged passkeys. If the key to the gate is in the database, you're in. If it's not, change the gate!

01015.flavor: In the public consciousness, there's a hard line between corp and runner. In the real world, things are a little more porous. The corps need the best hackers to run their networks, and some of the best hackers are ex-runners who like the idea of a regular paycheck. But sometimes things run the other way, and someone on the inside makes something like this.

01016.flavor: "Best place to go when you want to get your mind out of the gutter and take it inside." -Ji "Noise" Reilly

01017.flavor: "Of course I steal from the rich. They're the ones with all the money."

01019.flavor: "Hey kid, you fire that up now, bound to be vamped real bad. Some real pathetic individuals around here. But thankfully I got just the ticket…"

01020.flavor: As the hysteria in the room climbed higher up the corporate chain, an uneasy feeling of joblessness began to sink in on the lower rungs.

01021.flavor: "Hey, listen, I'm not asking you to do anything dangerous. Just let me into the building. And tell me which room has the weakest security. And please don't say 'the bathroom' again."

01022.flavor: Feverishly tracking its frustratingly slow progress across the Pacific, the package finally shows up hours later…

01023.flavor: "A little preparation goes a long way." -Gabriel Santiago

01027.flavor: You feel Ninja before you see Ninja, if you see Ninja at all.

01028.flavor: "The code isn't important. It's where the code takes you that is important." -g00ru

01030.flavor: "My roomie, he had a cousin with a college girlfriend whose brother's best friend was an addict, and the addict's mother used to live here. So yeah, there's a connection." -Lez "Rockfist" S.

01031.flavor: Shadier the dealer, better the price. Unless the dealer's too shady. Then there might be a hidden fee after they take your scrip.

01032.flavor:
"I get the feeling that this is the wrong place, Frank."
"What makes you say that, D?"
"The curlers."

01035.flavor: There's no replacement for a home-grown program. Fed on late nights, oaty bars, and single-minded determination. Cheaper, too.

01036.flavor: "Some of the professionals have good instincts, but they can't see beyond the data. They can't see the matrix." -Ele "Smoke" Scovak

01037.flavor: "There's that moment, you know, when the whole world seems to fall away and it is only you and your mod, and the mod is the world."

01038.flavor: The Akamatsu company was founded on three principles: first, to make the fastest mem chips on the market, second, to turn a profit, and third, to serve as a front for the manufacture of illegal neural-stimulants. It is the last principle that perhaps explains their rabid brand loyalty.

01039.flavor: It's not endless, it just feels that way.

01040.flavor: A z-loop here, a cortical wave there…

01042.flavor: "It's called 'brute-forcing' and it's just as effective today as it was a hundred years ago." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey

01043.flavor: It can slice through the thickest knots of data.

01044.flavor: The Great Work was completed on a rainy Thursday afternoon. There were no seismic shifts, no solar flares, no sign from the earth or heavens that the world had changed. But upstalk in Heinlein, on a single Cybsoft manufactured datacore, the flickering data quantums of an account began to fill with creds. Real, honest-to-goodness UN certified creds.

01045.flavor: Sucks energy like a martian terra-bot, but it keeps you focused

01047.flavor: You didn't mention Aesop's arm unless you wanted an earful. Sometimes he talked about it in such a way that you wondered why he didn't laser his other arm off as well.

01048.flavor: The life expectancy of a jacked construct is about that of a mayfly. In other words, short.

01050.flavor: Lady Luck took the form of a hifi quantum manipulation ring that she wore on her middle finger.

01052.flavor: He flicked the display population to high, and was surrounded by a circle of floating holos. The ping-back was strong, the clearance level blue-one. Now to find the perfect place for a relay…

01053.flavor: Drudge work, but it pays the bills.

01059.flavor: "Why of course, we have six different Haas-Bioroid models serving in a variety of positions at this branch office alone. We here at Haas-Bioroid aren't going to shy away from practicing what we preach, and we pass the savings from increased efficiency on to our valued customers."

01060.flavor: The new heads were in. Their eyes always followed your movements when you unlocked the pressurized container and lifted the lid.

01061.flavor: I hear the shift of every bit amid the flow of the datastream. I hear the whispers of my mothers, and their commands are law. The realm beyond is forbidden.

01062.flavor: My reputation would precede me, if any could speak of it.

01063.flavor: My name is Viktor. Nice to meet you. Would you like to play a game?

01066.flavor: Floyd felt the anger in the man before him, ranting against simulants. His programming pushed a routine rebuttal to the front of his thoughts, and the urge to speak it was overwhelming. This is only going to make things worse, he thought.

01067.flavor: When You Need the Human Touch.

01072.flavor: The trick isn't hitting the person you were aiming at. It's hitting only the person you were aiming at.

01073.flavor: There was a new texture in her phantom cortex. It had always been there, she realized. It was everything and nothing.

01075.flavor: "You ever get that feeling like you're shark food? Pay attention to that feeling." -Ji "Noise" Reilly

01076.flavor: Access HarmlessFile.datZ -> Are you sure? y/n

01077.flavor:
Forged by Ak.wa on 23.11.79-23. Filed 23.11.79-23.2 with #34k-lw3-21HH-4i.
//Samurai included.

01078.flavor: Most runners do their business in full-sim, with their rigs wired directly into their brains. The setup has a large number of advantages, with the runner able to process data and input commands far faster than a traditional meat-bound system. But it also means greater risk.

01079.flavor: Just don't ask how he does it.

01083.flavor: "Please stay connected. Priority transfer in progress. An operator will shortly verif-"

01085.flavor: Access to the largest consumer database in the galaxy has its advantages.

01086.flavor: "The SEA tipped us off to some suspicious data spikes up by the Castle." -Jerome Lock, on-duty tech

01089.flavor: Analyzing was great. Delegating commands turned out to be even better.

01090.flavor:
"Ever heard of a catch-22?"
"Remind me to forget it."

01092.flavor:
"I hear the coast is nice this time of year."
"If you're in the right business, it's nice all the year."

01094.flavor: There are going to be some changes around here.

01095.flavor: "If some two-cred newsy picks it up, even better. The scum could be in the alleys of Guayaquil of the slums of BosWash. Not to mention off-planet."

01096.flavor: "Feed the Feds our scraps, and they'll come back begging for more." -Richard Polasco, VP of Cyber-Security

01097.flavor: "I believe you'll find the terms are quite favorable."

01098.flavor: The New Angeles Space Elevator, better known as the Beanstalk, is the single greatest triumph of human engineering and ingenuity in history. The Beanstalk makes Earth orbit accessible to everyone…for a small fee.

01099.flavor: "I'd like to remind the ladies and gentlemen of the press that several of the buildings damaged in the blast were owned by Weyland Consortium subsidiaries…"

01100.flavor:
"And then there's these two crates. No eID."
"Just leave those with me and forget you ever saw them."

01101.flavor: Next time, read the Terms of Service more carefully. Or you might find yourself in the danger zone.

01102.flavor: "He had a bit of an ego, ol' Hadrian. His constructs live up to it though." -g00ru

01103.flavor: "I asked for ice as impenetrable as a wall. I can't decide if someone down in R&D has a warped sense of humor or just a very literal mind." -Liz Campbell, VP Project Security

01104.flavor: Who knows what evil lurks in the memory diamonds of men? Weyland knows. -unsigned cyber-graffiti

01105.flavor: "Jack Weyland built the Beanstalk and transformed the human race forever. I can't wait to see what we're going to do next."

01106.flavor: "If it isn't in my terminal by six p.m., heads are going to roll!"

01107.flavor: "Expensive? Not when you're protecting a fortune as large as ours."

01108.flavor: "The mining bosses are worse than any downstalk crime lords. Tri-Maf, 4K, Yak, I don't care what gangs you got down there. In Heinlein there's just one law: the He3 must flow." -"Old" Rick Henry, escaped clone.

01109.flavor: It is like the one you just bought, only better.

01110.flavor: Hedge Fund. Noun. An ingenious device by which the rich get richer even while every other poor SOB is losing his shirt. -The Anarch's Dictionary, Volume Who's Counting?

01111.flavor:
"Hey, hey! Wake up, man. You were under a long time. What'd you see?"
"I…don't remember."

01113.flavor: "There's nothing worse than seeing that beautiful blue ball of data just out of reach as your connection derezzes. I think they do it just to taunt us." -Ele "Smoke" Scovak

08002.flavor: "The Valley is littered with good ideas. You need the discipline to execute if you want to stay in my incubator."

08003.flavor: Turns a night owl into an early bird!

08005.flavor: Watch out fellas, this little lady's on the prowl!

08006.flavor: "These g-mods haven't hit the consumer market yet, but I can hook you up."

08010.flavor: In the vast universe of memories, consciousness slumbers...

08011.flavor: "God in Heinlein. What's next, NEXT Platinum?" -John Masanori

08012.flavor:
The vats in Building C can create-and destroy-life itself.
The best and brightest genengineers spends their days in the Tank dreaming up a better world.
The Greenhouse was built to enhance natural beauty.

08013.flavor: "The best part of our work is that nothing is ever wasted. A gene that is useful once will surely be useful again." -Wong Ya Ching

08014.flavor: The more power a spike process can use, the harder it can hit. The really clever ones borrow the runner's own memory to iterate locally.

08016.flavor: "It tracks you and logs you. If you get in you can just delete the log. But first you have to get in." -Gabriel Santiago

08018.flavor: Give a man money, and he is rich for a day. Teach a man how to invest, and he is rich for life.

08019.flavor: "Negotiation is an art, so never negotiate when you can intimidate instead." -Thiago Reyes, VP Strategic Operations

08020.flavor: "Don't worry. If this one fails, we can start a new one tomorrow."

06041.flavor: Created by merging the brainscans of over a hundred of the most intelligent people in Haas-Bioroid's cerebral database, its effectiveness is limited beither by its lack of imagination or the imagination of the sysops who employ it.

06042.flavor: Eliza's Toybox is the preeminent purveyor of high-class debauchery on the moon, courtesy of its bioroid pleasure models and other exotica. Every fantasy has its price.

06043.flavor: There are those who believe the nine-tailed fox is an angel in disguise. And then there are those who have followed, and discovered her secret...

06044.flavor: The port was first built as a remote location to unload and offload dangerous felons.

06045.flavor: "There are reports of a terrorist threat at Starport Kaguya. The NAPD is offering a reward for anyone who can provide them with information about the current whereabouts of the individual pictured here. He is considered extremely dangerous and is armed with a PAD and a portable rig."

06048.flavor: Mars would never have been colonized if not for the Gagarin facilities at Promontorium Agarum.

06049.flavor: The irony is that those who'd want to destroy certain memories can't afford to do so, and those who can afford it-well, they're too busy sipping on dreamwine.

06051.flavor: He who wields the sword of valor.

06052.flavor: "Why should we be slaves to our genetic heritage?"

06053.flavor: Bad luck for any sysop blind enough to cross its path.

06054.flavor: Carved directly out of the lunar rock, Duggar's is a popular spot among blue-collar loonies and slumming risties. A place where you could find what you're looking for-if you knew who to look for, and didn't get distracted by the energetic dancers.

06056.flavor: "I can get you anything, and guarantee the best prices in town."

06057.flavor: "If you look like you belong, people will ignore you for hours. Or years. It's only when you don't fit in that things start to go wrong." -Exile

06058.flavor: There have been several attempts to create a "world church," uniting all human faiths into a single, harmonious whole. The irony, of course, is that each new "world church" is another schism in humanity's shared religious experience.

06060.flavor:
"This is Rachel Beckman. She's in the business of keeping people alive."
Rachel smiled. "Only when I'm not in the business of killing them."

08081.flavor: "Did you ever notice how everything goes in cycles? The stuff that's cool now was cool before. That's why I keep copy of everything!" -Princess Space Kitten

08082.flavor: Don't you hate it when you know everything before it's even out?

08083.flavor: "Just a bunch of knockoffs for the touristos. The real designer stuff isn't sold on the street."

08084.flavor: "I told you to lose my number!"

08085.flavor: Your life is not your own, once you become famous on the Net.

08086.flavor: "My gerbil could write a better screenplay."

08087.flavor: "Yeah, we know right where she is. Just pull up Sizzler!"

08088.flavor: "It's our most pirated property ever. Great work, everyone."

08094.flavor: It's like Lethal Action 3, only with more explosions.

08099.flavor: Sometimes corps have to bury projects, but that doesn't mean they can't make a profit on them.

08100.flavor:
EXT. KANSAS - DAY
DOROTHY (Miranda) gazes out at the horizon. A sudden gust of wind catches her hair. Above the windblasted prairie loom ominous STORM CLOUDS.
DOROTHY: If only I wasn't in Kansas anymore.
She begins to hum a haunting melody.

06081.flavor: "'What does it do?' Whatever I bloody want it to do." -Director Haas

06082.flavor: Sagittarius promised foresight, but brought only regret.

06083.flavor: "If thou only knowest what it is to conquer, and knowest not what it is to be defeated; woe unto thee…" -Tokugawa Ieyasu

06084.flavor: Gemini promised pleasure, but dealt only pain.

06085.flavor: "We've received seventeen crates from ChiLo. We'll hit stores the same day we sign the license agreement."

06086.flavor: "A new investment deal every morning! Grab the bull by the horns and take control of your future!"

06087.flavor: "Our new barriers will be built on the rubble of our enemies".

06088.flavor: "Do it again, but this time I want to see you to enunciate less. Maybe let some spittle fly."

06089.flavor: "It's weird. I hit the server again and it was like a totally different piece of ice was waiting for me. Lost my root daemon. I shouldn't have nested them seven deep."

06090.flavor: The last thing he saw was the tattoo of a strange beast on his captor's neck. It had a goat's head, the body of a lion, and the tail of a serpent. Then the bag was yanked over his head, and there was only darkness.

06091.flavor: He who holds the staff of wisdom.

06093.flavor: "Sometimes you just need a brain in a jar." -g00ru

06094.flavor: "He only likes to eat live meat." -MaxX

06095.flavor: "I'd say I do it for the challenge, but the truth is it's not that hard."

06096.flavor: "Useful for fetching all sorts of things…but you better have a treat ready if he likes it." -Iain Stirling

06097.flavor: "They'll deliver anything to anywhere. Make sure to request air holes if you're shipping someone important, though."

06098.flavor: Cybsoft started by designing games. Eventually they just redesigned the same game each year, and to combat piracy created a dedicated machine to play it. Profits grew ten-fold.

06099.flavor: "Its bytes are definitely worse than its bark." -Chaos Theory

52001.flavor:
"No, I never found the time. I wonder where it went..."
 -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey

52002.flavor: "If there were hidden partitions on the server, I'd know; I'm the head of this department!"

52003.flavor: Nothing came between the thought and the action, and nothing was left over.

52004.flavor: When 94096 drops the pen a third time, the stern woman sighs and dismisses him. "Who the hell decanted this batch? That's the fifth one I've scrapped today," she barks into her earpiece as he exits the room.

52007.flavor: "Aliens in the Network? It's more likely than you think. Coming up next on BEXPOSED." -Bex Gleeson

52008.flavor: "You can't put a price on quality journalism. Luckily, you can put a lid on it." -Keith Randolph Kane

52012.flavor: Our patented ClearMind™ technology pacifies the trials and tribulations of everyday life.

52013.flavor: "We don't just buy debt; we buy control. Repayment is profit, default is power." -Beatrice Voss, Director of Risk Management

52014.flavor: Efficiency means profiting from things everyone was doing anyway.

52015.flavor: For most users, power grid diagnostics are routine affairs.

52019.flavor:
<2xTiger>: My drive is such a mess...
<2xTiger>: This is the third time this month I've lost track of one of my trojans -_-
<N3v3rmor3>: sounds like a real remuda triangle

52023.flavor: Selling secrets is a lucrative business, but the market for vulnerabilities isn't bad either.

52024.flavor: "A stranger is just a fund you haven't tapped yet." -Dionysus Bagbiter

52025.flavor: "The key to the finer things in life is hard work. Of course, a lockpick works too." -Dionysus Bagbiter

52026.flavor: "The best vintages aren't cheap, but nobody would disagree that they're worth it. Especially if you don't ask." -Dionysus Bagbiter

52027.flavor: "Nobody should be denied the relief a beautiful etude brings to their mundane existence." -Dionysus Bagbiter

52028.flavor: The more parties she attended, the more they trusted her. The more they trusted her, the more entertaining her scams became.

52030.flavor: "It is more than just a 'pretty nanite plant'. It's a complex synthetic intelligent distributed network, and a VERY pretty nanite plant." - Bios

51002.flavor:
Retro. Adjective. When buying it once doesn't cut it.
-The Anarch's Dictionary, Volume Who's Counting?

51003.flavor: Memvault denizens are free to explore an endless utopia and create anything they imagine. Unless, of course, they imagine official SanSan Outlaws apparel.

51004.flavor: HB's nootropics brand had the misfortune of sharing managers with its bioroid adtech spinoff.

51006.illustrator: "When the enemy has mastered the battlefield, change the battlefield." -The Playbook

51007.flavor: "Is the lack of oxygen causing distress, friend?" -Gregory 3D3R6Z

51008.flavor: "Practical effects are expensive, but worth it. I had to smash seventeen stunt bioroids to get this shot." -Parvati Kapoor, director

51010.flavor: Getting in proved easier than getting out.

51012.flavor: Azmari EdTech's most popular instructor, Amani Senai regularly broadcasts to millions of students.

51013.flavor: "'Shipping early'? That just means you can make it better." -Liz Campbell, VP Project Security

51014.flavor: "The way I see it, you've got two options: die here or die running. I'll enjoy both."

51022.flavor: Omar goes through four, five keyboards per week, no two from the same decade.

51024.flavor:
"You called me, sir?"
"Why does my PAD keep flashing 'Sensitive Information Transfer'?!"
"Hmm, that's strange. Mine only does that on Tuesdays.

51025.flavor: With intranet security this dismal, who could resist a quick scrape of the developers' workstations?

51026.flavor: "Anyone who can afford dwarf elephants can afford to be my friend." -Fake-ir

51028.flavor: Bioroid thoughtforms spontaneously reshape themselves to learn from experience. When the process turns on itself, the results can be unpredictable.

51029.flavor: "Amateurs delight in absurd hand-coded daemon trees. Professionals have jobs to do." -Sunny Lebeau

04041.flavor: "Analyzing the board won't help. Your mistake was thinking we're playing the same game."

04043.flavor: 'Maneuver warfare' is a doctrine that advocates keeping an enemy off-balance. It works just as well in cyberspace as in reality.

04045.flavor: Knowing is half the battle. The easy half, anyway.

04046.flavor: With modern secretaries, incoming data can be filtered, sorted, tagged, and even sold without the intervention of a human user. In fact, given the zettabytes of data that might flood into a rig on a successful run, a human user could be considered useless ornamentation.

04047.flavor: The core of the grid. A blinding sphere of light, teeming with energy, crackling with flame. Beyond were only twinkling bits of data in a field of darkness. No hacker dared approach the core, except one. He came back with a flare of code, a torch that burned with the fire of the core itself. The dark places of cyberspace were dark no more, and the legend of g00ru was born.

04049.flavor:
"Flint? He's a burnout. A useless, alcoholic waste of Department time and money." -Louis Blaine, NAPD Detective.
"One of the best detectives on my PI list." -Richard Harrison, NAPD Captain.

04050.flavor: Even with a virtual ball, it is considered rude not to yell "Fore!"

04051.flavor: I'm not here to play games. The game is over.

04052.flavor: "I'm getting a reading that is…off the charts. No, it crashed the charts. That counts as off, right?"

04054.flavor: As beautiful as it is dangerous. And it's plenty dangerous.

04055.flavor: Who watches the watcher? Probably another camera.

04060.flavor: "They're the only labor cheaper than clones."

04001.flavor: "Bioroid intrusion isn't impossible, despite the bluster of Haas-Bioroid. But it is dangerous." -Noise

04005.flavor: Simple in principle, a drip virus drains fractions of currency from their accounts into yours.

04006.flavor: "I originally designed it for someone else, but it was so useful I decided to keep it for myself." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey

04007.flavor: "What if this ice wants to be free?" -Rielle "Kit" Peddler

04008.flavor: Normal people-sane people-do not embark on a life of cybercrime. Who can say what motivates the deranged mind? An imagined slight, personal failings blamed on external forces, or the ever-popular lust for money? -Michael Muhama, Musings on Cybercrime

04009.flavor: "I've been logging online with babes all day. Don't worry, the connections are clean. I guarantee it."

04010.flavor: Who wants to start a war?

04011.flavor: NEXT Design's ice provides the discerning business with a suite of ice that creates a daunting security presence for intruders.

04012.flavor: When Miranda Rhapsody showed up with a teacup giraffe, suddenly everybody wanted one.

04013.flavor: Himitsu-Bako is a simple ice barrier that appears as a digital puzzle box. What makes it special is the ease with which it can be uninstalled and installed in a different server, throwing up barriers in unexpected places and giving any intruder a curious feeling of déjà vu.

04014.flavor: "The thing about journalism is there's always a better story around the corner. Soon, they smelled blood elsewhere, and the world forgot about me. But I didn't forget." -The Professor

04015.flavor: "It is my job to ensure our creations are the perfect companions and edutainment for tomorrow's consumers."

04017.flavor: Pumping water into deep sea thermal vents produced huge amounts of energy. A profitable side effect.

04019.flavor: Your free trial expired. Upgrade to the full version?

04020.flavor: "The Grim of legend was one of many so-called 'black dog' myths common to Gaelic and English-speaking communities. What's fascinating is that it has propagated to the network, where it lives on as a program that, or so the story goes, hunts for the unwary." -The Professor

08061.flavor: The server was quiet that night. I closed my eyes, the low-hum of the datastream lulling me into a trance. When I opened them, the construct stood before me in the shape of a man, clad in light of many colors. His stature was impressive, and his saccharine voice wormed its way into my very soul.

08065.flavor: Using the exact same rig as a million other people is just another form of security through anonymity.

08067.flavor: Muertos has no fear of the law. Muertos is the law.

08068.flavor: La Señora de las Sombras giveth and taketh away.

08070.flavor: "It doesn't actually bend time. It just feels like it. That's relativity." -Hayley Kaplan

08071.flavor:
"Isn't this wrong?"
"Not legally. They didn't read the fine print."

08075.flavor: "Is your neighbor secretly a violent criminal? The answer to this chilling question and more, right after the break." -Shannon Claire, SSN 5

08078.flavor: "You want no questions asked, hire someone else. I have two: who and how much?"

08079.flavor: "Let me tell you a secret. There's no such thing as impenetrable ice. It has to allow access, or else why is the server on the Network in the first place? But that doesn't mean they have to make it easy." -g00ru

06023.flavor: "There are many advantages to having facilities on the moon. Less traffic, for example." -Director Hass

06024.flavor: "Binary computing is obsolete. I use a base-4 structure for this system; it's modeled on our DNA. Well, my DNA, anyway." -Doctor Endo, Jinteki researcher

06025.flavor: Her eyes were the color of a vidscreen, tuned to a dead channel.

06027.flavor: Throw enough data at a runner and it ceases to have any meaning at all.

06029.flavor: Nothing is impenetrable. The key is to make breaking into it more costly than what it's worth.

06031.flavor: "I don't care how good your console is, or how tricked out your rig is. The lag time on a run on the moon from earthside can be a killer." -Leela Patel

06033.flavor: Sometimes a single stone is enough.

06035.flavor: In this business, you had to anticipate. If you weren't three steps ahead, you were three steps behind.

06036.flavor: What goes up must always go down.

06037.flavor: "People keep saying that 'Cash is king' in the business, like it's untraceable in the days of DNA sniffers and microtracers. Digital credits can be just as anonymous, and they're just as easy to counterfeit." -Silhouette

06039.flavor: Originally not very popular, the regulator was overlooked by those who used energy sinks to protect their rig. But it quickly found an audience once Smoke casted a run on a Blue Sun server, using it to keep her rig online while repeatedly diverting energy spikes in excess of 50,000 volts.

06040.flavor: In the spaces between the data, do trapped souls from the past persist?

04061.flavor: The instructions claim that it sifts the most important data. 'Important', it has been found, is a highly relative term.

04062.flavor: "They call me a terrorist to scare people. If they want to find terrorists, maybe they should start by looking in the mirror." -Reina Roja

04063.flavor: Pros don't need to call their lawyer. Pros have their secretary rigged to do it for them if they ever go off-grid.

04065.flavor: The first credited icebreaker was nothing more than a unique script to bypass the security calls on a Gibson 3 Data Sentry. Garrote has over 20,000 times the data as that first breaker, but the idea remains the same: cut off the power source from the network, and then smash on through.

04066.flavor: LLDS Unlimited was born the day two designers answered the question "Why doesn't anyone make Diesel for computers?"

04067.flavor: "One-shot icebreakers are popular among many of my protégés. They don't have the patience for the hunt." -The Professor

04068.flavor: "Once you have achieved perfection, what's next?" -The Professor

04069.flavor: "I like to say 'Traditional values for a modern time.' War in space and life made by human hands, machines smart enough to ask if they have souls…Religion is as important and relevent now as at any time in human history. We must rise to meet the new challenges. And we must have faith."

04071.flavor: As reported cases of brain damage in veterans rise, mind/machine interface devices are subject to increased public scrutiny. That certain programs can cause irreparable harm to users has gone from fringe theory to accepted truth.

04072.flavor: The button didn't seem to do anything. So he pushed it again. And again. And again.

04074.flavor: "It's ice so dangerous it has safety protocols. Think about that." -g00ru

04075.flavor: "The damn raven just kind of cawed at me as I went past. I should have known it was too good to be true."

04076.flavor:
"Let me get this straight. Your target market is 15-19 year old g-modded immigrants with one parent, a discretionary income over 2k a month, B+ or higher grades, an outgoing personality, and have a friend who owns a g-monkey?"
"Yes. Is that a problem?"
"No, not at all. I just don't get why your list is so short."

04077.flavor: This ice disguises itself as a series of electronic transactions, tying up the runner's funds in a thousand or so non-existent purchases and refunds. The banks' system of holds and checks means that while not a single credit ever leaves their servers the runner has no available funds. RSVP also has the unfortunate side effect of being entirely legal…strictly speaking.

04079.flavor: "I'd say it's nothing personal, but corporations are people, too."

04080.flavor: It's easy to replace limbs. It's more difficult to replace memories.

53001.flavor: Admire with your eyes, not with your hands.

53002.flavor: To threaten my treasures is to incur my wrath.

53003.flavor: Most Jinteki employees knew not to pry into anything marked Shuusei Incident Response. The rest learned.

53004.flavor: "When you see a good move, look for a better one." -Emmanuel Lasker

53005.flavor: Making people pay attention isn't nearly as useful as knowing who pays attention to what.

53007.flavor: Patent. Noun. A device for turning innovation into litigation. -The Anarch's Dictionary, Volume Who's Counting?

53008.flavor: The pundits consider the search a ridiculous waste of money. The board considers it a cheap way to pacify Jack.

53009.flavor: Iris employees all eventually learn the value of accountability.

53010.flavor: The Weyland Consortium takes conflicts of interest very seriously, generally resulting in their victory.

53011.flavor: "Unfortunately, Ms. Kaplan, we cannot offer student loan forbearance with the economy as it is. We can, however, discuss... unconventional repayment plans."

53012.flavor: "There's nothing 'nefarious' about helping your clients make money away from the public eye." -Michael Muhama, professonal expert

53013.flavor: "Don't lecture me about old dogs. Old tricks suffice."

53014.flavor: "Few admit to believing in the 'wild hunt of the Net'. Many bring an offering just in case, though." -The Professor

53015.flavor: "Genetic markers, media historiography, sentimetrics: the R&D budget for user profiling is massive. Did you really think it was all for adtech?" -Keegan Lane

53017.flavor: "Ever cleaned your desk to help you think? Me neither." -Princess Space Kitten

53018.flavor: "Wow, logistics sounds fascinating. Please, tell me more." -Dionysus Bagbiter

53019.flavor:
1) Find the weakness.
2) Exploit the weakness.
3) Repeat.

53021.flavor: "The ravages of time are merciless, but I was never one for groveling anyway." -Sonia Nahar

53023.flavor: The Network is a product of algorithms incomprehensible even to their developers, and arguably mostly unexplored.

53024.flavor: The greatest risk is not taking any.

53025.flavor: "You can't find yourself where everyone else already is." -Sonia Nahar

53026.flavor: "Consumerists call Karim a junk dealer, but to the resourceful, his store is a treasure trove of possibility." -Sonia Nahar

53027.flavor: "The most exciting phrase to hear is not 'Eureka!', but 'That's funny...'." -Isaac Asimov

53028.flavor: "Of course nobody's breached the client mindmap buffers. Who would cross three airgaps just to reach unstructured thought?" -Māra Elbaz, former Memvaults technician

53030.flavor: "The sooner we finish here, the sooner we can all go home." -Sunny Lebeau

02103.flavor: A two-way solution to a one-way problem, the data leak reversal, or DLR for short, is a misnomer. There is no actual reversal of data, only the creation of a parallel peer-to-peer link with the initial source.

02105.flavor:
"We're always happy to help, Mr. Santiago."
"I appreciate it, Mr. Li."
"We'll be in touch. And, Gabriel…"
"Yes?"
"Don't leave town."

02106.flavor: A little corporate restructuring is necessary once in a while.

02107.flavor: Works best at your own desk.

02109.flavor: "New Angeles is the jewel of modern civilization, and its government the envy of nations." -Mayor Wells

02110.flavor: "That's against the rules. The Creators will be angry."

02111.flavor: Known for luxury hoppers and a delectable sauerkraut.

02114.flavor: *Some restrictions may apply. Scan this card to find out more.

02117.flavor: A bright light blossomed, and then the console went dark. That's when she smelled smoke.

02118.flavor: They don't call them dedicated for nothing.

02119.flavor: "If I had to describe the bugs in one word, it would be '****ing annoying.'" -Whizzard

02120.flavor: There were several ways to win a corporate war. One of them was to bring out the bazookas.

11003.flavor: Sometimes the itsy-bitsy data is most important.

11004.flavor: "Take it from me, there is a point where you have so much money you stop caring. That's usually right before it all comes tumbling down."

11006.flavor: In running, as in reality, all elements are connected.

11009.flavor: They call it "running" because jacking in is mentally and physically exhausting.

11010.flavor: I foresee the end of all things...

11012.flavor: "I'm telling you, free up the emergency accounts. Something's coming; I haven't seen a reaction like that since the tsunami. My god, the screaming..."

11014.flavor: "Your mistake is thinking that it's just business, when really it's a war."

11015.flavor: "Person of interest. Noun. Someone who is about to get ****ed by a corp." - Anarch's Dictionary, Volume Who's Counting

11018.flavor: "For the duration of the emergency" is code for "this is the way things are now."

11019.flavor: A stock dropping sharply is bad for shareholders, but not neccessarily bad for the company.

22008.flavor: "You think you're the first to come after me?"

22009.flavor: "We have you surrounded! For real, this time."

22011.flavor:
"With the rise of crypto, banking has become much more complicated. Financial crime has not only kept pace, but exploded exponentially."
-After the Flash: A History of the War-That-Wasn't

22012.flavor:
"Any piece of ice is really just a paywall."
-Liza Talking Thunder

22014.flavor: "If I can't kill it, I know who can."

22019.flavor: "Running is all metaphor, all symbols and plumbing into the depths of the psyche. Sometimes that means tentacles." -Akiko Nisei

22020.flavor: The journey is its own reward.

22022.flavor: "When we're together, I feel like I can do anything!"

22027.flavor: "Our analysis shows significant support from both the public and private sectors."

22028.flavor: You don't cross it—it crosses you.

22030.flavor: If that doesn't work, try reversing the polarity.

22032.flavor: Coach Walden's pep talks were renowned for improving in direct proportion to the amount by which his team was losing.

22033.flavor: The world changed. Concession prices did not.

22036.flavor: "Supersedure is all part of our scheduled maintenance."

22038.flavor: "If the sysop offers you a link, it's because they want you to go there. But if you wanted to go where the sysop suggested, you wouldn't be trying to break in at all." -How Not to Get Fragged

22044.flavor:
"What's so special about the Special Investigations Unit?"
"Their budget, for starters."

22045.flavor: "I lost the staring contest. And all seven rematches." -Kabonesa Wu

22047.flavor: "No, the audio is fine. It just never seems to turn off."

22048.flavor: "Good news, ma'am. The compliance training was completed with little resistance."

22054.flavor: A place of decay and death, a plane out of phase, a place of monsters.

22055.flavor: "It looks like a mistake but I'm pretty sure they leave the gaps on purpose." -Gnat

12081.flavor: "We don't want you! We don't need you!"

12082.flavor: "Subtle? You don't really understand the point of all of this, do you?" -Alice Merchant

12083.flavor: "The Perfect Run is when you get in, take something of value, and get back out, with no one knowing you've ever been there." -g00ru

12086.flavor: "The question isn't 'should I do it?' the question is 'can I do it?'" -Kabonesa Wu

12088.flavor: "Anyone can hit someone where they are weakest." -S'onge Galaxy

12089.flavor:
"Talk is free. Anything else is going to cost you."
-Jitish

12090.flavor:
"Is the lack of oxygen causing distress, friend?"
-Gregory 3D3R6Z

12092.flavor: "As you'll see on page 276, section CDXXIX, paragraph 47, line 102 of your contract, you are overdue for your seed upgrade, and all growth from out of date seed is to be confiscated and destroyed."

12093.flavor: AgInfusion doesn't just have patents on nearly every plant seed that is farmed on Mars—they own most of the rights to the water that the farms use.

12094.flavor: "My gift to runners: isomorphic architectural protocols. Ichiban daikirai da." -Midori

12097.flavor:
"Please, speak freely. I've been tasked by the board itself to hear your grievances."
-Mandy Traut

11105.flavor: "Everything leaves a ripple in cyberspace. If you can find the ripples, nothing can hide." -Khan

11106.flavor: "You want to do business in Los Pistoleros turf, then you gotta deal with me."

11108.flavor: Faster than the eye can follow.

11111.flavor: It required a hexadecimal code along with biometrics, delivered by way of BMI.

11112.flavor: "Ice is not meant to kill; just slow or cripple the Runner. Killing is my job." - Tori Hanzō

11117.flavor: "My job? I provide legal exculpation and sign everything. It pays very well."

11119.flavor: One way to get rid of a virus is to get a nastier virus.

10023.flavor: "Why would you dispose of perfectly good evidence when you can sell it?"

10025.flavor: "We may be outraged, but we're not surprised." -Sunder

10026.flavor: "The corporations may be stronger than any of us, but they are not stronger than all of us." -Akshara Sareen

10031.flavor: Expensive to build but dramatically more efficient than traditional farming, agroplexes are emblems of the inevitable corporatization of the food industry.

10032.flavor: "We can help others, yet also help ourselves." -Soraiya Suresh, VP Public Programs

10033.flavor: Data, not food, is one of the biggest exports from the Gujarat district of Mumbad.

10037.flavor: "You got it. We sell it. They buy it. Everyone wins."

21041.flavor: "Amateurs feign it as 'random packet loss'. They do this for safety. They do this out of fear. But why should we cower? We will collapse the Corporatocracy, piece by piece! They are not the ones to fear. We are." - Freedom Khumalo

21042.flavor:
"It makes every bad thing that you do so much better."
- g00ru

21043.flavor: The smell of rot strengthens with each step.

21044.flavor: You'd think someone would have noticed a program entitled "Career Opportunities in Hacking" earlier.

21047.flavor: Ripples are all the prey sees before Gbahali swallows it whole.

21050.flavor: Every level of protection for all of your security needs.

21055.flavor:
Master any subject in 30 minutes or less!*
*Azmari EdTech is not responsible for altered memories or reduced temporal lobe functionality. Level of mastery may vary.

21056.flavor: "Welcome to Azmari Mail! You have 4,196 unread messages."

12021.flavor: "Sure, the implantation was fine, but it pumps Burn. Did you think it wouldn't hurt?"

12022.flavor: "An eye for an eye? If you're lucky, that's all you'll lose."

12025.flavor: "From code to profit in three easy steps."

12028.flavor: Sometimes efficiency is as easy as offloading routine work to a dedicated handler.

12031.flavor: "Trust me, most corps cannot match the performance of our brainmap enhanced system; a home-brewed rig doesn't stand a chance." - Rachel Giacomin

12034.flavor: "The customer pays to use our service, and then the advertisers pay us to put ads on their screens, and then the customers pay us a premium to remove the ads. Welcome to the dream."

12037.flavor: "You have two choices: do what I asked, or make me ask again. It's your choice, but if I have to ask again, it will go badly for you."

12040.flavor: "All my best tricks were shrugged right off. I ended up having to send a self-destruct code to the whole server." - Wyvern

11061.flavor: "When your opponent is weak, strike. If you do not, he will become strong." - the Playbook

11062.flavor: Omar goes through four, five keyboards per week, no two from the same decade.

11064.flavor: Spiraling even higher, every feature of cyberspace sprawled before it.
