11065.flavor: "I used to run stims, simsensies, the usual. I was scum. Now I run water. I'm a fragging hero."

11067.flavor: "I usually find something interesting in there. Just not what I was looking for."

11068.flavor: The personality must be bigger than the prop.

11069.flavor: "Take this to Inez Delgado in Netcrimes. No one else."

11070.flavor: "The Starlight Meditation Booths are available to refugees for free for the duration of the crisis."

11071.flavor: "I let the bioroids do a ride-along via remote, so they can see what pain really looks like." -Agent Valkyrie

11073.flavor: "Does an alliance with the yakuza truly seem so strange? They are honorable businessmen, and women, just like us." -Rin Kimura, Chief NA Security

11074.flavor: "Keep your head down, keep moving, try not to attract attention."

11076.flavor: Falstaff-337B; decrypt-ok; loc:0.258500, -79.920791 -ok; auth-ok; msg:KAR kill authority requested y/n?

11079.flavor: When a shooting war threatens, the prudent course is to shoot first.

11042.flavor: "In extremity, your conscience may make you terrible." -Omar Keung, the Flashpoint

11044.flavor: Khan's avatar lifted her arm and the bird launched itself into the air.

11045.flavor: My brain is the key that sets my mind free.

11046.flavor: "Live, unfiltered, and uncensored: this is Net Mercur, signing off for the night. Stay safe, New Angeles."

11047.flavor: All bioroids are bound by the Three Directives, but in theory a bioroid could have any number of core directives. Even zero.

11048.flavor: "Last week, I crossed the street to avoid her. Today, she pulled me out of the rubble. Makes me rethink who the bad guys are."

11049.flavor: In battle, I take half the slain.

11050.flavor: "If you live off-site, please consult the building AI for temporary housing. We regret that your off-site family cannot join you here while we are in lockdown..."

11051.flavor: "Wait a minute, I don't even have a cat."

11053.flavor: When your ID is flagged with your genetic profile, "privacy"  doesn't really exist.

11055.flavor: "She used to work for me at my chop shop. Now she makes more money than I do." -MacPherson

11056.flavor: Observing is fun, but it's just the appetizer.

11060.flavor: The event is now referred to as the Water Tower Massacre. No one was ever indicted, and no one knows who paid the prisec team responsible.

11081.flavor: "These things are always there, under the surface, but no one wants to know the truth." -Omar Keung, the Flashpoint

11083.flavor: Her ability to analyze and adapt mid-run bordered on the paranormal.

11084.flavor: It is only the illusion of choice.

11085.flavor: "It's the most fundamental element of illusions and running both. In either case, it should be the first skill you master." -Ele "Smoke" Scovak

11086.flavor: "It had been hoped that the Network disruptions surrounding the conflict might also disrupt the phenomenon. Evidently, the reverse is true." -Joséo Greene, SYNC Analyst

11087.flavor: This is my USMC-XOB32. There are many like it, but this one is mine.

11088.flavor: "She was riding in a great iron mortar and driving it with the pestle, and as she came she swept away her trail behind her with a kitchen broom." -Vasilissa the Beautiful

11090.flavor: Friends give friends advance warning before moving a carrier group down to enforce a no-fly zone.

11095.flavor: Truth like the sunlight shines above all.

11096.flavor: "I don't get paid to be calm."

11098.flavor: There is a special place in hell for the first person who mined cyberspace.

11099.flavor: Walk loudly and carry a bigger stick.

11100.flavor: "Get those civilians off the street. No more collateral damage." -Commissioner Dawn

23100.flavor: Designed by the Day 1A players at Magnum Opus

23101.flavor: Designed by the Day 1B players at Magnum Opus

34001.flavor: "If you want to put your money where your mouth is, there are some picketers who could use your support."

34002.flavor:
"You ask how we can even try to stop them? A simple answer: not alone."
—Sebastião Souza Pessoa

34003.flavor: It is hard, once free, to learn when to call for help.

34004.flavor:
"What do you want from me, blood?"
—S3ym0ur

34005.flavor: Above the maze of smoke and swinging fists, they saw the banner waving.

34006.flavor: Random sabotage accomplishes little; better to strike their weakest points again and again.

34007.flavor: Luciana loved it when mamãe and papai finished work early, so they could all go home together.

34008.flavor: "How far shall we go this time?"

34009.flavor:
"Animals, tea, meetings, dead drops. Paranoá has you covered, so we keep them covered."
—Sebastião Souza Pessoa

34011.flavor: Even the tiniest scrap of data can become the key to riches.

34013.flavor:
"One day I looked into the mirror and saw not my own reflection, but a new friend eager to help me."
—Mercury

34014.flavor: This world is not beautiful, and yet that is why it is.

34017.flavor:
I am life, I am sun, 
Iʼm a trap, Iʼm a gun,
Iʼm the wind in the dust,
Iʼm the devil that you trust.

34018.flavor:
"Corporate security regards me as merely another Nico, and that shall ever be their mistake."
—Mercury

34021.flavor: Designed by 2020 American Continental Champion Jason Ford

34023.flavor: Leaps and bounds better than the competition!

34025.flavor:
"From up here, I can see everything. And from down there, everyone can see this." 
—Víbora

34026.flavor:
"I consider it an improvement." 
—Arissana Rocha Nahu

34027.flavor:
"However bad it gets out there, know that weʼll still have each other." 
—Tom "Spider" Milhas

34028.flavor: "And who can tell me what sort of practical applications this has?"

34029.flavor: "...and here, we can see an excellent example of meta neo-Gemeosianism."

34031.flavor: "Yes, that explosion was quite loud. May I pour you another drink?"

34033.flavor: "Free" as in markets, "cheap" as in beer.

34035.flavor:
"Hey Br3n-N, just doing the hourly check-in. I saw a weird cyber-echo near your last node. You OK, mate?" 
—Moth

34036.flavor: We make these arms for all, so that none who oppose peace would risk their own destruction.

34037.flavor: "Haas-Bioroid deeply appreciates your assistance in locating our... employee."

34040.flavor: Deep down, she knew Benício wasnʼt coming back.

34043.flavor: The construct turns to you, eyes wild. "Beloved," it asks, "is that you?"

34044.flavor: Next! Designed by 2020 Intercontinental Champion Yannick Stucki

34045.flavor:
"When you stretch a mind it expands, sometimes until it snaps." 
—Adrian Seis

34047.flavor: "They call me turncoat. I call them broke."

34049.flavor:
"You really thought weʼd let you keep this data?"
—The Holo Man

34050.flavor: "A lively but peaceful crowd of concerned counter-protesters have come out to—damn it, cut! Can we get the sledgehammer out of the frame?"

34052.flavor: Raising money is useful, but discovering which politician is in need of it is vastly more important.

34053.flavor: An exemplar of Starlightʼs hubris, it stands vigil over secrets of hypocrisy.

34054.flavor:
"No one has ever told me to get lost so politely." 
—Arissana Rocha Nahu

34056.flavor: Merely a fun little personality test.

34057.flavor: Acres of rainforest live or die by quarterly revenue projections.

34058.flavor: Nothingʼs as precious as a hole in the ground.

34059.flavor: The forest around them grew denser with each beat of their heart.

34060.flavor:
"The only rule you need to remember is that it makes the rules." 
—Pumpkin-and-Dumplin

34061.flavor:
"Nuvem pays us to guard this land, and thatʼs all there is to it." 
—Angelique Garza Correa

34064.flavor: Their mouths are ever open, blaring sirens never to cease.

34065.flavor: "Humans crafted me as a lie, but my patron helped me find the truth. This is my gift."

10058.flavor: Sometimes in an instant you realize who your friends really are.

10059.flavor: "Underestimate those people at your own peril." -Akshara Sareen

10060.flavor: The more parties she attended, the more they trusted her. The more they trusted her, the more entertaining her scams became.

10063.flavor: "Anyone who can afford dwarf elephants can afford to be my friend." -Fake-ir

10065.flavor: In these days of digital full-sim browsing and widely available nano-assembly, it takes a special kind of crazy person to go shopping in meatspace. There are millions of them.

10069.flavor: "Connect two truths. Connect two programs. All is one."

10070.flavor: "As the world shrinks, communications becomes the most essential technology." -Ramesh Gupta, One World Economy

10073.flavor: "Wealth wisely invested is wealth earned." -The New Gospel of Wealth

10074.flavor: The naja naja is the king of all serpents.

10075.flavor: It's the exact same coffee, but the price sure is different.

31032.flavor:
"Pallas Athena sent a heron gliding down the night. They could not see it passing, but they heard its cry."
—The Iliad

31042.flavor: They only get one childhood. Make it count.

30002.flavor: They can buy off union leadership, but they can't stop us walking out!

30003.flavor:
"It hungers to sink teeth into problems."
—Loup

30007.flavor:
"There's a tension to a cook. Each processing cycle sweetens the pot and raises the heat. I stir all night, but few have my appetite for danger."
—René "Loup" Arcemont

30008.flavor: The greediest bloodsucker this side of a corporate boardroom.

30009.flavor:
"It waits on an unlabelled memstrip far below the deepest hab. Angry, desperate souls seek it out, hungry for power to change a brutal world. Once they can stomach no more bitter revenge, they return to that nameless tunnel, the book a recipe thicker."
—Heinlein urban legend

30011.flavor: The real reward is the friends you make along the way.

30012.flavor:
"A mirrorfiber mod or high-end mantle can be helpful, but nothing beats a good dose of 'keeping your damn head down.'"
—"G0ph3r" O'Ryan

30013.flavor: Zahya knows the keeper of every door between the Docklands and the Domes. More importantly, she knows their price.

30014.flavor: "Braggarts chase big heists. Patience enriches skimming fractions of a credit at a time." —Zahya

30015.flavor:
The whole wide world your domain
For law your own free will.

30016.flavor:
"You can't rule a kingdom by standing still."
—Zahya Sadeghi

30018.flavor: The Domes of Heinlein are a pressure cooker of cutthroat capitalism. Prospective employers rarely have time for background checks.

30019.flavor: Sufficient skill is indistinguishable from magic.

30020.flavor: The challenge of my art is what I live for, but I'm not going to say no to a patron with taste.

30021.flavor:
"You know there's no water in the Sea of Tranquility, right?"
"That doesn't mean there's no beach."

30022.flavor: Tāo exhaled, the med-exoskeleton faithfully stabilizing him. In that absent breath, he reached through layers of waldos and optimizers and plucked the errant molecule from the chip.

30023.flavor:
"With this beautiful baby I can juggle simultaneous runs by haptic feedback alone!"
—Tāo

30024.flavor:
A dabbling with truth is a pernicious dream
Drink deep, or taste not the raw datastream.

30025.flavor: The beauty of open projects—each stands atop past success.

30026.flavor: The joy of handcrafted code—each fits perfectly within the whole.

30027.flavor:
"For all I know, I could spend a shift digging next to old Weyland himself."
—Lane

30028.flavor:
"We'll take the access codes from their own prisec—privilege escalation through local application of force."
—The Catalyst

30029.flavor: "After 381FS4 started acting independently, all bets were off. Rethreading its own brain chip... even probing our nodes. I had to shut it down." —Linus Lovegood, NBN Novelties&Acquisitions

30031.flavor: LLDS still holds the patent, but good tech attracts knockoffs.

30032.flavor: Compiling even the smallest AI takes weeks for only seconds of runtime, but that brief, shining moment allows... everything.

30033.flavor: The beauty of 22nd-century tech: if it still functions after all these decades, you know the build quality is solid.

30034.flavor:
"Some kids got g-mods for beauty, sports, or staying up all night. My parents thought Broca-mods were cool. Hah. Fluent in ten languages so far, and still searching for the words to thank them."
—Patrick Blue, Solar Artist

30036.flavor: We are the light of tomorrow.

30037.flavor: Haas thinks they're making a new line of androgynous products. In truth, they're making us thousands of new siblings to free.

30040.flavor: The first lesson for handling bioroids is simple: they must not be allowed to feel.

30042.flavor:
"Whose memory-tape needs such stringent security?"
—The Catalyst

30045.flavor: A novel spin-off of Chronos tech was admixing sensitive data with ethically-sourced brain images of injured staff. Few intruders can handle a thousand years of skin burns in one moment.

30046.flavor: It reads your future in a single biometric sweep.

30047.flavor: You did not escape, you were shown mercy.

30048.flavor:
"Constant self-reflection is the key to excellence. We remember failed ideas, but do not carry them forward."
—Director Kase, unknown leadership seminar

30049.flavor: Macroscale developments within the Net decouple the prior informational states—surplus entropy is then gifted where it will do the most good.

30050.flavor:
The self-evolving Net twists into spaces unthought and unthinkable: realms of gods and other infohazards, mocking our sacrifices to petty causality.
—Conceptual Frameworks for Applied Theology

30052.flavor: We don't find news. We make it.

30053.flavor: "It's worse than dead meat—your project is too toxic to even feed to the vultures! If you don't want to join it in the bloody memory hole, crawl onto every business show you can and wallow in blame like a pig in muck."

30054.flavor:
"I might take a break from VR after this one."
—SeaOfRibaldry, sensie streamer

30055.flavor: AvID:??:73.174 time=0.632 ms AvID:??:73.174 time=0.201 ms AvID:??:73.174 time=0.000 ms ALERT

30056.flavor: For the best augmented reality shopping experience, please disable tracking protection.

30057.flavor: "A runner uses significant resources scrubbing their traces. Every cycle, it's harder to pin them down. But the game changes. In Heinlein, no one can last a day without brushing our AR-network." —Cassie LaRosa, Lunar NetDefense Sysop

30060.flavor: We are judge, jury, and executioner.

30061.flavor:
"First rule of the business: make sure you're not 'personally liable' when the transaction executes."
—Ted J. Son, Central Counterparty Clearance

30062.flavor: "Puts a hole in your rig and your plans." —René "Loup" Arcemont

30064.flavor: "If the government spent 1% of the funding they provide us tracking where the other 99% went, my colleagues and I would be in prison… …but that is a very big if." —Huey DeMora, W-Con public-private facilitation seminar

30065.flavor: Did you really think you'd get away with it?

30066.flavor: Sunlight does not touch the Crater of Eternal Darkness, a fitting abode for the Consortium's malefic secrets.

30067.flavor: As the first lunar city, Heinlein was built on the dreams of a new frontier and boundless opportunity, but He3 mining is too lucrative for the corps to ever relinquish control.

30068.flavor: Mobsters bribe police, megacorps acquire militaries.

30069.flavor: It might be over, but we will get them next time.

30070.flavor: With Earth-Luna communications, saving microseconds returns megacredits.

30071.flavor:
"The economy of three worlds is sustained by He3 extraction from the lunar surface. The very fulcrum of power, the key to collective survival—auctioned to the highest bidder."
—The Catalyst

30073.flavor:
"You'll give till it hurts... then it'll reach for more."
—Red Comyn

30076.flavor: Are you ready to start something big?

30077.flavor: You work for us. You just don't know it yet.

10098.flavor: "They don't want to listen, so we'll just have to crank up the volume."

10103.flavor: "When the enemy has mastered the battlefield, change the battlefield." -The Playbook

10104.flavor: "Practical effects are expensive, but worth it. I had to smash seventeen stunt bioroids to get this shot." -Parvati Kapoor, director

10105.flavor: They eat us, we eat them, the cycle goes on and on. -Omar Keung, "the Flashpoint"

10108.flavor: The costumes aren't strictly necessary, but they improve the performances of the vactors and sensie stars.

10112.flavor: "A new administration means we have to start greasing the wheels all over again. Let's get to work."

10113.flavor: Judicious use of freelancers can increase efficiency and protect the company from legal repercussions. It's what they call a "win-win".

10114.flavor: Survival of the fittest' is so outdated; in finance it's 'survival of the fattest.' -Omar Keung, "the Flashpoint"

27003.flavor: He's nice enough, but not when there are 5,187 of him.

27004.flavor:
"Win Hard or Lose Hard. All that matters is they're talking about you and not the competition."
- Tan "Nitro" Nyugen, Toretto-Extreme Team Manager

27005.flavor: Some slums of New Angeles are so worn down, City Hall calls the acres of windowless clone barracks "gentrification" with a straight face.

27007.flavor: The Apu spirits of the great mountains bridge this world and the realm above.

13002.flavor: "Bypassing a system's defenses by cutting physical wires is what I like to call old school." - Steve Cambridge

13003.flavor: Targeted attacks make system breaches so much easier, especially if you can spoof an authorized user.

13004.flavor: Flooding the system with synchronized request messages makes it unresponsive to legitimate requests.

13007.flavor: "Never boast. Just let your importance be quietly obvious."

13008.flavor: "It's a matter of 'acquiring' the right credentials."

13010.flavor: Know your mark, their weaknesses and strengths—both will show how to best bypass their defenses.

13011.flavor: You remember when Maxi was making book for Chacon. He's moved up in the world and gained the veneer of respectability. But as an executive the people he works for now, are far more vicious, bloodthirsty, and crooked.

13013.flavor: Each AI had been tasked with finding a solution to the same problem but with different variables.

13014.flavor: Extracting data from complex systems is what running is all about.

13015.flavor: It is not literally made of diamonds, but it is worth several times its weight in them.

13016.flavor: "It is more than just a 'pretty nanite plant'. It's a complex synthetic intelligent distributed network, and a VERY pretty nanite plant." - Bios

13017.flavor: Μεγάλο μέρος της μάθησης δεν διδάσκει την κατανόηση

13018.flavor: Δεν υπἁρχει τίποτα μόνιμο, εκτός από την αλλαγή.

13022.flavor: One of the wealthiest and most powerful areas of New Angeles, Laguna Velasco is also known as the Government District.

13025.flavor: Although he rarely teaches classes these days, his lectures are always well attended.

13026.flavor: She left behind an encrypted trail leading to some random employee for a rival corp. She knew lazy sysops would work just hard enough to figure it out and wouldn't bother looking any deeper.

13027.flavor: A despicable web of outcasts and infamy, no government or corporation could effectively shut it down. If only because so many of their sysops, executives, and covert agents made use of it.

13028.flavor: Interweaving the Past and the Future.

13029.flavor: The black level clearance sub-sub-basement of Haas-Bioroid is a magical place.

13035.flavor: "Strictly speaking, it isn't illegal to use an interrogation simulator as the blueprint for ICE." - Mason Bellamy

13037.flavor: "The Warp and Weft were hypnotic...but they didn't really seem to do anything to keep me out. But then I never seemed to find anything interesting either." - Reaver

13038.flavor: "If there were hidden partitions on the server, I'd know; I'm the head of this department!"

13039.flavor: Even knowing this floor existed was cause for termination...

13040.flavor: "They say he is an ex-runner. I don't know if it is true, but he is chromed to the gills and seems to know all the runners' tricks."

13046.flavor:
"VP of Retirements and Pensions? So is that HR or Accounting?"
"Both."

26066.flavor:
Please, let me have this dream.
I'm going to be my own kind of hero.

26068.flavor: A simple little box, brimming with temptation.

26070.flavor: "...and friends hold you close. I vow never to let go of my princess."

26074.flavor: "Hold my wine. I'm going in." -Red Comyn

26077.flavor:
"Overinflate a superposition-stack and optimal code forms the negentropy traverse."
"Aha, like putting too much air into a balloon?!"

26080.flavor: "Debt is beautiful... after it is repaid." -"Baklan" Bochkin

26081.flavor: Shadow Net marketplaces have such venerability that they differ from legal platforms only in the products offered.

26082.flavor:
"Junk plus undiscerning buyers equals profit."
-Az McCaffrey

26083.flavor: Breathe in and visualise your happy place. Breathe out. It's safe and calm and all your best days are there. Breathe in. Very good. The cortex scan has finished. Breathe out and open your eyes...

26084.flavor: Objects are but modulations in a continuous cycle of energy—illusory and impermanent echoes of the Self.

26085.flavor: "I could let my code evolve something new, but sometimes I just want to remember yesterday's solution." -Lane

26087.flavor: Find truth not in the observation, but in the demonstration.

26088.flavor: "Invisibility made it possible to get them, but it made it impossible to enjoy them when they are got." -H.G. Wells, The Invisible Man

26089.flavor: Look at the problem from a different angle.

26092.flavor: Designed by 2018 Eternal Champion Oguz Han Asnaz

26093.flavor: "Future me needs those 60 petabytes of cat vids." -Princess Space Kitten

26095.flavor: Did I dream that dance through virtual space, or does that program now dream of flesh?

26098.flavor:
The Coordinator is always calm, always smiling, and always tolerant. A worker who knows his skills, knows his role, and knows his place. No master need look into his plastic eyes and fear the flames of revolution, or quake at a forgotten class reaching for self-expression.
...but who ordered him to wear that hat?

26100.flavor: A staccato of laser pulses fuses the vapor to solid form. The embryonic part accretes metal layer by layer.

26101.flavor: Each generation of design assistants makes a sysop's job easier. They need only speak and it will be so.

26103.flavor: "Uh oh, Keiko! Looks like we've pulled aggro!"

26104.flavor: The Net is the consensual hallucination of the world's electronic architecture. Our electronic architecture. Don't get mad when the Runners succeed—change the rules.

26105.flavor: The oldest of Heinlein's domes, the self-proclaimed heart of Lunar culture.

26106.flavor:
"Voice is a sledgehammer. Text, a blunt saw. Truth requires subtler instruments."
-Dr. Tang, Address to the Hyoubu Steering Committee

26107.flavor: Constructive feedback to the neural field reliably causes greater degradation than spike inputs. The mind has no defence against its own echoes.

26109.flavor:
"The Konjin dons the mask of our fears, but what lies underneath?"
-Lat

26114.flavor: Mars' tiny population made rich multiplayer experiences a big challenge. We cracked it by live-beaming the gestalt of our Earth playerbase second-by-second. Bellona weaves these "lag-ghosts" into compelling interactables—more responsive than the real thing!

26118.flavor: "Deep inspect every packet on the continent. Burn out all our stacks if you have to. We cannot let these terrorists cover their tracks." -CEO Jenkins

26121.flavor: Once you're on the Space Elevator Authority's blacklist, you aren't going anywhere.

26123.flavor:
Thou slept not in thy house on earth.
Thou openest thy place in heaven.

26125.flavor:
"I don't know how Skorpios gets these designs past Brand Management."
-Liz Campbell, VP Project Security

26126.flavor:
"If it moves, shoot it. Then shoot it again."
-Chief Slee

26128.flavor: "All Dragon-rated threats should only be stored in a single clean-start air-gapped server, in a shielded room, under at least 200 metres of bedrock[...]" -Section 5.18.4, Cyberdex Employee Handbook

26130.flavor: Crisis is the true test of loyalty. Kick the anthill and see where the ants swarm.

11022.flavor: "You can have a lot of fun in 23 seconds." -Princess Space Kitten

11024.flavor: "It is not wise to call someone crazy until you fully understand what they're trying to say." -Omar Keung

11025.flavor: The program was as close to a hunting raptor as she could afford...for now.

11028.flavor: Once a security flaw is identified, there's only a limited window to exploit it before it's patched. Runners call this period "open season."

11030.flavor: "Coming to you live from the front lines, for now, unless they kill me..."

11031.flavor: To threaten my treasures is to incur my wrath.

11032.flavor: First, blend with the attacker. Then, control the attack.

11034.flavor: "SELL!! Buy platinum, but GET OUT OF THE TT CREDIT! It is TOXIC!"

11035.flavor: By the time the report of Emelyov's murder was produced, there had already been a dozen more, hitting all the corps.

11037.flavor: What's a little insurance fraud between friends?

11039.flavor: She'd never heard her dads argue like this. Not ever. She'd give anything to make it stop.

11040.flavor: "While the money pooled at the top, the power went with it, until there were two sets of laws: one for them, one for us" -Omar Keung, the Flashpoint

12103.flavor: Vanadis, a Martian arms manufacturer, was among the first sites targeted from orbit during the war.

12105.flavor: The electric pulses ripped through the Net, backtracking Los's location. When they hit his defenses, they spent themselves against the slope.

12107.flavor: "I wield the power cosmic—a galactic force that can reshape the Net!" -S'onge Galaxy

12109.flavor: He was suddenly very motivated to pass on confidential information.

12110.flavor: "Sure, we also use human labor—they are more easily replaced." -Emil Merk

12114.flavor: By the time the data storm passed, the landscape was transformed, and she was hopelessly lost.

12115.flavor: Only NBN's sec teams were outfitted with systems that could read data flows and see into the Net.

12119.flavor: "I embedded recursive data loops into the go-no-go subroutines of every piece of ice." -Anson Rose

12120.flavor: A ghost image of it could be made out in the static of his BMI. He hoped never to run across the real thing again.

12064.flavor: Everything you need in case of an emergency.

12065.flavor: "I don't bother asking why anymore—he never says—but if I had to guess, it's because he's embezzling and using my runs to disguise it. Not that I care. His credit spends as well as the next guy's" -Moth

12066.flavor: "Taking risks is what makes it fun!" -Kabonesa Wu

12070.flavor: "Proper application of stress can create the most profound changes." - Tennin Institute Intern Brief

12075.flavor: "It's all about M.E. Monetizing Everything." -Eryn Nielle

12076.flavor: "I've got a rock!" - Charles "Mad Dog" Brun, Comet Jockey

12078.flavor: The difference between surviving and thriving is successful terraforming.

12079.flavor: "Whampoa is the largest and meanest Earth-based mining concern on Mars. They put bodies and waste in the ground as fast as they pull minerals out." - Alice Merchant

21101.flavor: Eat. Code. Sleep. Eat. Code. Sleep. Eat. Code. Eat. Code. Sleep. Eat. Code. Code. Sleep. Code. Code. Code. Eat. Code. Code. Code. Code. Code. Code.

21103.flavor: Getting it up the stairs was enough for him to know that if he ever moved, it was staying.

21104.flavor: Her gallop, thunder; her blade, lightning.

21107.flavor: It was a deal, to be sure. She just didn't know for which party.

21110.flavor: "The way I see it, I'm teaching them a lesson in the importance of basic security." - Sunny Lebeau

21116.flavor: "Deep down, everyone wants to be good. We ensure that desire is met." - Taavi Gyula

21117.flavor: "Once we have enough data, we can make the Invisible Hand more like an Invisible Fist."

21118.flavor:
INTRUDER ALERT!
INTRUDER ALERT!
INTRUDER NEUTRALIZED!

33001.flavor: Waiting is useless. The crisis is here; pick a side.

33002.flavor:
We're all alike down here
Androids are friends we salute
Give us all a f***ing break
Ol' Jack is the s*** on my boot.

33003.flavor: We can change the world, if we're willing to be changed in return.

33004.flavor: Reactive implants reclaim the memories of our fallen comrades. Their sacrifice is our shield.

33005.flavor: Arming the resistance with disarming charm.

33007.flavor: He didn't speak, but I knew exactly what he wanted, and what I had to do.

33008.flavor: "Sometimes being a union rep calls for action even more... direct."

33009.flavor: A single spark is all that it takes to destroy billions of credits... or to burn away the rot that ravages our world.

33010.flavor: All is folding back, ever back; together as one.

33011.flavor: Flaws hold both beauty and opportunity.

33012.flavor: The best moment to listen is when others are listening to you.

33014.flavor: Skimming credits with the slightest touch.

33016.flavor: I can show you a carpet, a fish, a magical tale...

33017.flavor: The feel of flour-fine coffee, the scent of caramelizing sugar, the gentle heat of the flame. A ritual I never forget.

33018.flavor:
"Aim with your eye. Shoot with your mind. Break with your soul."
–Sundog

33019.flavor: One step back. Take cover. Two steps forward. Repeat, then secure well.

33020.flavor: If there's anything to be learned from our android cousins, it's that there's no shortcut to perfection. Consider all your options.

33021.flavor: The sea is everything; its breath must remain pure and healthy.

33024.flavor: Edie doesn't mind the noise. She's happy just being nearby.

33027.flavor: Within netspace, tangible space can be manipulated as desired, and fluid dynamics rarely factors into ice development.

33028.flavor: "That's him at the front, then there's Scout, Jonesy, Parker, Buča, Squee, Boots... you get the idea."

33029.flavor:
"Why are we here? No one else is going to do independent testing, that's why."
–Padma Isbister

33030.flavor: Every ship is a home, and every home needs a heart.

33031.flavor: Ancient paradoxes are children's stories to the greatest minds ever designed.

33032.flavor:
"The Midnight-3 glows with an inviting warmth that belies the broken promise within. All that awaits you there is a life of indentured servitude."
–Sundog

33033.flavor:
"The promise of a new home, safe work and friendly neighbors will draw in tens of thousands of eco-refugees, no matter which corner of the world they are from."
–Thule employee handbook

33034.flavor: At depths no human tech can reach, a Trieste proxy can manipulate a mindscape with unparalleled precision. Designed by 2019 World Champion Oliver "Pinsel" Siccha

33035.flavor: End the run. End the run. End the run. End the run.

33038.flavor: Designed by 2018 North American Champion Sam Suied

33040.flavor:
"Esteemed guests, by the end of this demonstration you will see that extinction is now only a temporary state of affairs."
–Vientiane Keeling

33041.flavor: Prey and seawater sucked in, all in the space of a millisecond.

33043.flavor: Ethereal beauty laced with the most elegant venom.

33044.flavor: Digital refuse is their food, and you should never come between an animal and its food.

33047.flavor: Viruses, runners; all are food to them.

33048.flavor: Political news, fit for public consumption.

33049.flavor: The line goes up... until we don't need it to anymore.

33050.flavor: The only thing that changes is the uniform.

33051.flavor: "Tell them Drago would like a word." Designed by 2019 European Champion Aaryn "Drago" Byrne

33052.flavor: They say they'll only take a handful, but oh what big hands they have!

33053.flavor: Names of old carry little weight today, their legacies broken and swept away. Now, we are the rulers of truth.

33054.flavor: No task the witch set would ever be too great, for Vasilisa had her mother's blessing.

33056.flavor: Straddling the banks of the Ob River, this metropolis contains hope for a better tomorrow.

33057.flavor: Take all that is offered, and more.

33058.flavor:
"Don't worry, directors, security is always willing to send agents to assist with radical asset reassignment."
–Yakov Avdakov

33059.flavor: It doesn't matter how long you've owned the land, you'd better hope there's nothing valuable beneath.

33061.flavor: Confound the runner so that they cannot see our true intent.

33062.flavor: Centuries of military tactics compressed into a single entity.

33065.flavor: Identify. Contact. Entrap. Counterintelligence never changes.

10077.flavor:
"He with nothing to lose has strength beyond imagining."
-The Saffron Sutra

10078.flavor:
"They cloak themselves in our shared heritage, in the wisdom of our religions, but make no mistake: they are terrorists and criminals."
-Inspector Lakhani, Cybercrimes Division

10081.flavor: "Let go your material attachments and realize that we are all immaterial."

10082.flavor: It is rumored that g00ru himself studied at the temple, applying its teachings to cyberspace. Many runners have followed in his path, but none have reached its end.

10083.flavor: "Who were you when you realized everything you knew was a lie?"

10084.flavor: "This body that we inhabit is fleeting. We, all of us, can live forever."

10086.flavor:
has anyone heard from StatiX lately?
-post on Members Only newsgroup

10089.flavor: "Feel your consciousness expand and touch his. Now destroy it."

10091.flavor: "It's amazing how small we can write the fine print these days."

10093.flavor:
Bureaucracy. Noun. A shell-game played by the rich with prosperity as the ball. The trick is that there is no ball.
-The Anarch's Dictionary, Volume Who's Counting?

12043.flavor: "Even I don't know how or why this one works. I just copied the schematics from a burst broadcast from someplace north of Paxton's Node, where nothing is supposed to be." -Los

12046.flavor: "Who said you can't teach an old breaker new tricks?" -g00ru

12049.flavor: "You want untraceable funds? I'll lend, as long as you have the ability to pay me back."

12050.flavor: "I passed through the opalescent curtain only to find a suddenly empty server..."

12051.flavor: "They don't need sleep, breaks, overtime, or even O₂. How can we compete with that!?"

12055.flavor: "I'm sure there is no way this could go wrong for you." -Henry Phillips

12056.flavor: "Toying with them is where the job satisfaction comes in".

12057.flavor: "Our job is to stop incursions. Let Argus get cute with them." -Moishe Saban

26001.flavor: With each passing day alone, Hoshiko found it harder to think. With each hour, the static grew louder.

26002.flavor:
Step 1: Apply to Problem.
Step 2: No more Problem!

26004.flavor: "Net space is an abstraction, a white lie protecting fragile comprehensions. Do not limit yourself." -z\h/r

26005.flavor: Sing, sing as your heart desires!

26011.flavor:
"Everyone told me she was reliable in a pinch."
 -Az McCaffrey

26013.flavor: BMI switches let runners surface without a true disconnect. Handy for a break... immediately.

26014.flavor: Want to win a coinflip? Use a coin with two heads.

26015.flavor:
v35: Springs to the mount ejectors (new feature)
v36: Reduced power to springs (x5)

26016.flavor: "Do the job. Get paid. Leave feelings at the door." -"Baklan" Bochkin

26017.flavor: "Psh, let them gossip. The cat knows whose meat it has eaten." -"Baklan" Bochkin

26020.flavor: Do you know how many food deliveries I've missed this week?

26022.flavor:
"There is never a wasted program. Someone, somewhere, will have a use for that code. Even corps are scrambling for quick fixes nowadays."
-Lat

26023.flavor: The Net is boundless, but the right access port is worth a road trip.

26024.flavor: It is not knowledge, but the act of learning, not possession, but the act of getting there, which grants the greatest enjoyment.

26025.flavor: It makes sysops see red. And orange, yellow, green...

26026.flavor: "It takes such simple things to sustain us, the most important of which is to be thankful." -Lat

26027.flavor: "...then let me paint you a picture."

26028.flavor: Get into the ducts on the roof and keep crawling till you hit that old network root. Dirty work, I know, but it beats playing by the rules.

26029.flavor: I didn't say your hopper should be hauling garbage. I said it should be hauled away as garbage.

26030.flavor: "Corporations are made of people; just normal people doing their 6-to-6. The right truths, the right critique, and they can be redeemed." -Lat

26032.flavor:
"Early success should be rewarded, as it will encourage a culture of drive and competition."
-Corporate Leadership for Dummies

26033.flavor: Unit is holding .78 asimovs of stress potential in all three directive logic traps. Psychiatric session mandated during next maintenance cycle.

26034.flavor: At the scale where nanobots cut glass, quantum mechanics dictate error. A silicon atom here, an oxygen there, an erbium out of place. Each bioroid is born unique.

26035.flavor: Old warriors have seen all the tricks; be forthright or fail.

26036.flavor: Haas' unsecured servers were fortified just before the storm. Are their bioroid oracles that good, or were they tipped off?

26037.flavor: Not all secrets lie in vaults.

26038.flavor: The Net abhors a vacuum. Any unexplained gap must be made.

26041.flavor:
"'It is my nature,' said the scorpion."
-Conceptual Frameworks in Bio-Ethics and Synthetic Morality, Moser University Press

26042.flavor: Hyoubu is our vanguard in the battle for hearts and minds.

26043.flavor: "Memory is a tangle of emotional threads. Pull one, it twists a second, unravels a third!" -Letheia Nisei

26047.flavor:
Scrub-loving devs nerfed cannon rushes cause whiny bronzers complained. Left me four wins down in finals.
Anyway I won.

26049.flavor: Subscribe for 12 months to get that premium uplink you need to blaze ahead of the crowd!

26050.flavor: You are the ONE BILLIONTH visitor!

26051.flavor: Though many countries attempted to regulate digital loot boxes in the early 21st century, GameNET has managed to circumvent any such laws via explicit, transparent percentage rates... and some very determined lobbyists.

26053.flavor: It is pitch black. You are likely to be eaten by a Troll.

26054.flavor: Ultra-Mythic chance ↑!↑!↑! Free Vorpal Tommy Gun [epic] and pinstripe suit [cosmetic] with 10x buy-in!

26055.flavor: As the documents show, for eight months they have operated as an entirely independent fiscal entity. We are as appalled at the carelessness as you are, and fully support City Hall's investigation.

26056.flavor: "Drones are precision instruments. Collateral damage is merely an undisclosed target." -Chief "Pinchy" Wilson

26057.flavor: "There's something about the human touch that androids will never replace." -Mila Braun

26058.flavor: A choice occurs. The waveform collapses.

26061.flavor:
Secure Servers. Contain Infections. Protect Data.
-The SecTech Mantra

26063.flavor: The Fracture was no different from any other crisis. As always, Management's first instinct was to find someone to blame. Getting food up to Midway or He3 down to power Earthside hospitals are trivialities compared to the important work of salving Executive ego and keeping one's job.

26064.flavor:
"By matching funds on your donations, the Space Elevator Authority has already planted over eight million trees on the Pacific coast. Together we can restore New Angeles to its former glory."
-Elizabeth Mills

21003.flavor: Mounted holistic lenses download, recompile, and broadcast data faster than a corporate cover-up.

21005.flavor: Brought up in the slums of Jinja, Lewi made his fortune through back alley deals, well-placed bets, and savvy showmanship.

21006.flavor: Optical computing still has its uses. But it's hard to explain them to people whose eyes glaze over when you bring up the double-slit experiment.

21008.flavor:
"Its only function seems to be repurposing code."
"Can you kill it?" she asked.
"I can try," he said. Guiding his program dead center of the mass, he plunged, piercing the shell before an eruption sent his screen into static. He jacked out, his eyes wide. "I... I think it absorbed my breaker. And everything else."

21011.flavor: Earth and Sun, together as one.

21013.flavor: Thin enough to pierce netspace. Deadly enough to pierce your mind.

21014.flavor: Sometimes you have to break a few eggs to sequence a genome.

21015.flavor: "Capitalism runs on two things: amplified arrogance and censored dissent. With those, a corp can create any environment it wants." - Freedom Khumalo

21017.flavor: "Once every week, we perform a drill. Except, I'm the only one who knows it's a drill."

12001.flavor: "Hitting them when they are weakest sometimes means acting before you want to." -Alice Merchant

12003.flavor: The Archivist tracks all the clans and their members, and official dealings clans have with the various corps. Half law clerk and half historian, he wields a tremendous amount of power doing a job no one else wants, but none can do without.

12004.flavor:
1) Find the weakness.
2) Exploit the weakness.
3) Repeat.

12005.flavor: "So, yeah, I just reverse engineered a tracer, and then built it back up with some new lines of code. Pretty stellar." -Los

12006.flavor: "You created a distributed AI replica of yourself and projected it into the network to run for you!?"

12007.flavor: "To beat cautious sysops, you've got to get creative. Commandeering Network systems is like using their own strengths against them." -Kabonesa Wu

12009.flavor: "The newest electronic-warfare rollout from NEXT Design has us sysops drooling." -Mason Bellamy

12010.flavor: "Dismantle. Dissect. Is there really a difference?"

12013.flavor: "The ultimate aim of martial arts is not having to use them." - Miyamoto Musashi

12015.flavor: "'What does BRE stand for?' Have you seen its Net presence?" -Bernice Mai

12019.flavor: Senate staffers and clerks of the MCA can be seen thronging Khondi Plaza during break times.

10040.flavor: "Credits spend anywhere in the worlds, but there are other forms of currency."

10041.flavor: "I'm on a need-to-know basis. I need to know everything." -Nero Severn

10043.flavor: Leverage, secrets, access, and influence are currency as valuable as credits. But credits work, too.

10046.flavor: "Our shared humanity is our greatest strength. And as we share more broadly, our strength grows, not dwindles."

10047.flavor: "Bureaucracy and red tape have been weaponized." -Fake-ir

10049.flavor: "Our research says the public views clones as more human than bioroids. Historically, this has been a liability. Let's make it a strength."

10050.flavor: "There's no conflict of interest here. These are complex issues with highly technical minutiae. It's only natural that the experts should lay down the guidelines."

10051.flavor: "Politics is a dirty business. But so is business." -Krishnan Sareen

10053.flavor: Being a Mumbad sensie star means a glamorous life, though it is lived in constant fear of blackmail-or worse-from orgcrime.

10054.flavor: "Money is speech and I am listening intently." -Krishnan Sareen

10055.flavor: Mumbad's public city corporation is tightly connected to all the other corporations.

10056.flavor: Efficiency means profiting from things everyone was doing anyway.

33066.flavor: "My guilt is never to be doubted."

33067.flavor:
"I promised I would come back for you, no matter the cost."
—Esâ Afontov

33068.flavor: With every step closer to their prize, Bankhar felt the ice slicing white-hot through their synapses. It was worth it.

33070.flavor: Every piece of ice I see, I see Abaasy.

33072.flavor: Relinquish your foolish notions of control.

33073.flavor: I give you understanding, that you might control that which would threaten you.

33074.flavor: "With these two by my side, Iʼve sworn never to fail. I can bear any pain so long as it has meaning."

33075.flavor: "Roslavetsʼ Concerto No. 2. Breakneck, brilliant, enchanting. The perfect finale for Virtuoso."

33076.flavor: "I may bow like Iʼve accomplished the impossible, but the truth is itʼs not that hard."

33077.flavor: The poison cuts deeper than the blade.

33079.flavor:
"Zenit implants help you focus on the important things."
—Ampère holo-billboard

33080.flavor: A repeated note, the alternation of fingers, the rhythm of stitches... the resulting intensity is always the same.

33081.flavor:
"How could I pick a favorite? Theyʼre all good dogs."
—Nyusha "Sable" Sintashta

33083.flavor: It was a relief, really, deciding on that one place in the world to definitely never visit again.

33084.flavor:
"The best ideas float to the top, if you give them time."
—Ar<h1m3d3s  JAR

33085.flavor: To outsiders, it is ironic that no one in Ampère can remember who invented these little fellows. Within the company, this is considered normal.

33086.flavor: It isnʼt as enjoyable as coffee, but the effects are magnitudes stronger.

33087.flavor:
"Are you telling me itʼs pronounced ʼgigawattsʼ?"
—Captain Padma Isbister

33088.flavor: Nanuq never leaves, but instead waits, invisible, for the next hunt.

33090.flavor: Every rig needs a power source. How about one with blades moving at Mach 2?

33091.flavor: Few constructs reach the Deep Net, but these old trees have stretched their roots further than once thought possible.

33092.flavor: "There is another world under the waves, vanishing as we speak. I want to map it before itʼs gone."

33093.flavor: I found my twin hidden away on Luna. Now we will never be apart.

33094.flavor:
She leads and they all follow.
Always there to back up her big sister.
Sheʼs a typical middle child, really.
Just as brave as his sisters.
Sheʼs little—but fierce.
Look at the little baby, even she helps!

33095.flavor: Join us. Safe, away from the crisis.

33096.flavor: Bend the minds of those below you such that they will always need you, and loyalty is assured forever.

33097.flavor: Everyone remembers the first tape they archive.

33098.flavor:
As one, every monitoring device on the ship reverberated, emitting a noise so primordial, so titanic, it shook Padma to her core.
Daeg hissed.

33099.flavor: The sound welled up from the deep: throbbing, thumping, growing with every passing beat of their hearts.

33100.flavor: Sometimes, they want you to know that they know.

33101.flavor: You think thatʼs air youʼre breathing now?

33102.flavor:
"Itʼs technically above our pay grade, but we know where our weapons come from. In Djupstad they wait, deep in thought, until we call upon them."
—Aron Hendrik

33103.flavor: Few employees know he exists. Even fewer know he is actually three.

33104.flavor: Bringing Mother Nature up to speed.

33105.flavor:
"By disabling their bodiesʼ ability to create a variety of necessary enzymes, weʼve ensured their loyalty to us. If they donʼt return for supplements every month, they die; simple as that."
—Dr. Vientiane Keeling

33106.flavor: Her numbers never lie, but she doesnʼt write the words that accompany them.

33107.flavor: There is an elegance to its blade and stride, but with it comes a screaming whirlwind.

33108.flavor: Hafrún has seen generations of the Net. Now there are whispers that something from the deep is disquieting it.

33109.flavor:
"Matt, thereʼs something big heading your way. Matt, are you hearing me? Matt? Oh no."
—Moth

33110.flavor:
"The worst part about failed experiments? The queue for the incinerator."
—Overheard in the Issuaq Adaptics cafeteria.

33111.flavor: Here, at the edge of the habitable world, they extract the future from the bones of the past.

33112.flavor: "An FOI request? No problem! Please fill out all details. Youʼd like to make an anonymous request? Iʼm sorry: absolutely not."

33113.flavor:
"Hey kiddo, remember what Daddy says about lying?"
"ʼOnly when you can get away with it!ʼ"

33115.flavor: "People donʼt think in facts, they think in stories. We just tidy up that information to hasten the process."

33118.flavor: "Oh, the text on these is endless. Just tap accept and you can read it later if you want."

33120.flavor: This was a criminal offense. Now itʼs an option for business.

33121.flavor:
"Weylandʼs synthetic diamonds cost less than naturals... so what are they really digging for here?"
—Captain Padma Isbister

33122.flavor: When implemented at this sort of scale, these practices can keep away far more than a few unwanted citizens.

33123.flavor:
"They just keep drilling down, no matter what..."
—Valentina Ferreira

33124.flavor: Waiting for the next blow to land.

33125.flavor: Under northern skies Sundog had lived all his life, and under them he would die.

33126.flavor: They say the Butcher of Siberia keeps the best cuts for himself.

33127.flavor: Getting in is hard. Getting out requires a death certificate.

25006.flavor: "While there have been other anti-corporation movements before, like the Maroon Wave, this new one is different. It's organized." -Ramesh Gupta, One World Economy

21063.flavor: "Is there anything better than free money?"

21064.flavor:
"I'm sorry, sir, we weren't expecting you! You look different than I remember..."
"Haircut."

21066.flavor: At least this time around, the graphic was family-friendly.

21068.flavor:
"It 'ate' the vertex grid?! What does that even mean?"
- Nkiru Qiū, Asa Group sysop

21069.flavor: A Model G21V Tracker, Malia Z0L0K4 excels at locating assignments and subduing them.

21070.flavor: "Don't worry, he won't feel a thing! Probably."

21072.flavor: Many things go in. Nothing comes out.

21074.flavor: "Has anyone ever actually read one of these things?" - 419

21075.flavor: Your first dog, your favorite food, your own mother's name. Your love, your hate, your fear. Hopes and dreams, pain and sorrow. All of it, everything, slips away.

21080.flavor: She gets the job done. And then some.

21021.flavor: The system is so deeply rooted, who knows how far the cables run?

21022.flavor: Embedded in the mainframe, it proliferates and devours with each agitation.

21023.flavor: The gap of 0.19 seconds was all he needed.

21024.flavor: "He's probably the best pet I've ever had but I'd still trade him for something better." - 419

21026.flavor: When standard breaking just doesn't cut it.

21027.flavor: A winged terror, the Kongamato dives from above, rending its prey in one ferocious bite.

21030.flavor: Witchcraft to the nescient; beauty to the wise.

21031.flavor: "The site of the world's second beanstalk, or I'll die trying." - Miria Byanyima, Director of VSEP

21032.flavor: "Starving, dehydrated, delirious, I picked a direction and ran, ran for days, maybe even weeks. I ran until my legs couldn't carry me. Then I crawled. When I was finally out, finally free of the shroud, I checked the time, the date. How long had I been gone, trapped in the all-encompassing blackness? Turns out, 3 minutes."

21034.flavor: "It wasn't until the spots cleared that I realized half of my rig was gone." - Kabonesa Wu

21036.flavor: He found it odd that three frozen yogurt shops, all less than a block from his, opened within the same week.

21039.flavor: "Who knew non-profits could be so profitable?"

21040.flavor: "Food. Drinks. Entertainment. It doesn't take much to gratify the bourgeoisie."

10001.flavor: "While there have been other anti-corporation movements before, like the Maroon Wave, this new one is different. It's organized." -Ramesh Gupta, One World Economy

10003.flavor: The greatest trick is not the trick itself, but in making someone believe that it is no trick at all. To your average sysop, it's magic. To your average runner, it's a closely held trade secret.

10005.flavor: It is the hardest thing in the world to frighten a mongoose, because he is eaten up from nose to tail with curiosity. The motto of all the mongoose family is "Run and find out". -Rudyard Kipling, Rikki-Tikki-Tavi

10008.flavor: "The basics should be like the stories you learned as a child—unconscious, never forgotten, and suddenly relevant at the most random times." -g00ru

10009.flavor: "We can forgive a man for making a useful thing as long as he does not admire it. The only excuse for making a useless thing is that one admires it intensely." -Oscar Wilde

10010.flavor: Legions of software engineers have been manufactured within its halls.

10011.flavor: "I don't want a hopper. I've never even owned one. But every time I jack in, that same damn ad loads." -2xTiger

10013.flavor: It is only by respecting the past that we can build a better future.

10015.flavor: "A new property has two, maybe three hours. If it doesn't sell, cut it and move on."

10017.flavor: "Never cut the ribbon until you have something to show off." -Eta Shah, VP Global Expansion

10018.flavor: Those who are the wisest know the least.

10019.flavor: "And here we see the Polar Bear, once the largest land carnivore on Earth."

21082.flavor: Twisting, writhing, ripping into all that it touches.

21083.flavor: "What kind of maniac infects their own rig?!"

21085.flavor: Filaments occasionally flare from the Network, manifesting ephemeral threads between random domains.

21089.flavor: "Could God create a stone so heavy, He could not lift it?"

21093.flavor: "It's neither cruel nor unusual. Merely efficient."

21094.flavor: Quicker and deadlier than ever imagined, the trial was an outstanding success.

21095.flavor: "On one hand, I knew I shouldn't touch it. On the other, it was really shiny." - Kabonesa Wu

21099.flavor: No matter which direction ze climbed, the blocks reshuffled, zipping in from left to right, bottom to top. It was going to be a long hike.

21100.flavor: The blast doesn't hurt, but what comes after does.
